dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a spectacular example of PEUCETIA VIRIDANS. Descending through mid-air on a silken thread. Neon green with black leopard spots on its legs. A Green Lynx Spider As we follow it down, the threaded opening of a GLASS JAR appears from the bottom of frame. Just before the spider continues inside the jar, it stops suspended. Something's not right. It waves a leg tentatively through the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... Just a little lower... WIDEN TO REVEAL a Middle School TOILET STALL. Standing on the lid of the closed toilet, holding the glass jar up ov his head, is DARREN SHAN. Darren is 14 and a well-liked kid. Tenacious. Diligent. The spider just hangs there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... I'll take good care of you. All the bugs you can eat.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE SCHOOL BOYS ROOM
dialogues.text: The door bangs open and STEVE LEONARD enters. Unlike Darr Steve's not so well-liked. In fact, he can be trouble. Maybe that's why they're friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Darren! No answer. Steve walks along the stall, scoots low so he see any feet in front of the bowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you fall in? Darren!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... Steve looks to the last stall, sees the jar being held up INTERCUT from in and outside of the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna scare him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, we're getting killed out there. It's three to nothing. Darren is all concentration as the spider drops a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your problem, Steve, not mine... Steve gets a waggish idea. Stepping to the sink, pressing his forefinger over the spigot, he turns the faucet. WATER SHOOTS out in a stream, which Steve directs into an then over the stall door. Reacting, the spider zips up it thread, is lost in the darkened ceiling. The stall door opens. Dripping water, Darren stares at St who flashes a wicked grin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids eat lunch, off in their groups. On the field: Darren has a SOCCER BALL practically glued to his foot. He dribb through defenders, shoots, SCORES! Steve pumps a fist:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOAL! Three to one! The other team regroups, starts back upfield with the bal Darren steals it. A few strides and WHUMP! Darren catches the goalie too far out. The ball lofts jus over the backpedaling goalie's head, bounces into the goa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three to two! Angry at himself, the goalie KICKS the ball away. It veer off toward the street. Steve takes it as a personal insul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that prove? Huh? The goalie blanches as Steve moves at him. Kids are nervo about Steve. He likes to fight. Darren gets between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get the ball. It's 3 to 2. Lunch's almost over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why he kicked it. To kill time. Well, I still got time to kick your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. The ball. Steve decides, heads after it. The goalie gulps in relief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Darren. He's crazy. Darren watches after Steve. He does have a vicious streak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve tracks down the ball which has rolled into the stre From seemingly out of nowhere... A gleaming black 1966 LINCOLN Continental. Its tires suck at the asphalt as it rolls. The windows blacked out. It speeds up reaching the ball. Ba-Dump! The ball BURSTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot! The car SCREECHES to a stop, idles ominously. Suddenly St doesn't seem so tough. He looks nervously back to Darren. But as a WIND picks up, the Lincoln suddenly tears off. A sheet of PAPER is kicked up by one of the car tires. Th wind sends it sailing. It drifts down, until... Steve notices, snatches it out of the air. Darren steps up beside him, watches the Lincoln disappear down the street. Creepy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. The paper is a FLYER. A startling, violent layout. Beneat a snarling WOLF'S HEAD: CIROUE DU FREAK - Human oddities other living curiosities. Midnight. Zeiterion Theater. $2 - Admission is at the discretion of the proprietor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Human oddities and other living curiosities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other. Does that mean not human?
Darren shrugs, takes the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freak show. Ever been to one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this school. Darren turns the flyer over. There are tire tracks on the back. They hear the sound of distant tire squeals, but th Lincoln is long out of view. Just an empty street now...

dialogues.speaker: A BOA OCCIDENTALIS
dialogues.text: Probing the confines of its glass prison. A BOA CONSTRICT by any other name. It's a prison within a prison because we're inside...

dialogues.speaker: THE SCHOOL SCIENCE LAB
dialogues.text: The teacher, MR. DALTON, moves ponderously around the roo His voice like a metronome.

dialogues.speaker: MR. DALTON
dialogues.text: As you can see reptiles and amphibians are not one in the same. As Mr. Dalton continues, we see various PAIRS OF STUDENTS their computer screens showing text or pictures of variou FROGS, ALLIGATORS and LIZARDS... DARREN and STEVE sit together staring at a Komodo Dragon. After Mr. Dalton passes by, Steve switches screen views. He's done a WebSearch of Cirque du Freak. There are a doz or so entries. He picks one: History of the Side Show. Under 1920's there's an older, much more 'Victorian' pamp for the Cirque du Freak. A more ornate version of the sam Wolf Head. The same notice from the proprietor. Steve spreads the flyer out to compare. They whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a different one. Steve scrolls down through pictures:

Sword swallower and glass eater: OHIO GRAY. Frog boy: AVERY CHILDS. Human skeleton: J.D. COMBS. .and then... Egyptian Soothsayer: LARTEN CREPSLEY. Crepsley's gaze is startling. Like he can see through the screen, even from 1923. Steve looks like he's just seen a ghost. Suddenly, he hits print. As a PRINTER against the wall clicks to life, Steve looks back at Darren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta show you something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture perfect: two stories, dormers, trellises. 9-year- ANNIE rides up on her bike, bookbag over her shoulder. Without stopping, she hops off, dumps it on the lawn by t other bikes. A few steps and she's through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moody for the daytime. Only the light from the half-close blinds streaking the floor where: Darren and Steve are huddled over several clippings and pictures that Steve has spread out. They all deal with VAMPIRES in some form or another. Steve pulls another sta from his backpack, spreads them out as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires. I've been studying them. Vampires? Darren looks at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. You're failing half your classes at school, but you're studying vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They been around 1000's of years. Two tribes. They even fight wars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sometimes, when humans fight? They fight at the same time. And no one knows it. Like at the Battle of Stalingrad they fought at the same time the Russians and Germans were fighting. Darren just looks at him, wonders if he's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people know about it. There have even been books written. He pulls a frayed old yellow hardcover from his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your proof? It smells. Steve's really trying to convince him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's everywhere if you look. On the internet, in blogs, newspapers, weird places. But you can find it. The room starts to tighten a notch around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I chatted online with one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious. We become aware of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone watching Darren and Steve through the half open doorway. It moves in, starts coming up from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was his name? Mr. Dracula? Mad now, Steve opens the book, flips pages, finds an old Century painting. He slaps down the science lab internet print-out of Larten Crepsley. It's the same guy! Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is in 1923. And here 1855. Huh? Maybe he'll be there tonight. Would that make you believe? As Darren looks them over, the POV looms up behind them. Suddenly Darren spins... And ROARS at what's behind them: his sister Annie. She SCREAMS in response. Steve jumps a mile. Darren LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw your shadow on the floor. Gotta try harder, knucklehead. Steve snaps his book shut, shoves it in his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me one, too. Steve gets up, stomps out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve opens the refrigerator, looks to see what's in ther At the same time Darren's MOTHER arrives home. Coming in through the kitchen door, she sees the refrigerator door open, two sneakered feet behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you want to fight global warming, Darren, but that's not the way to do it. Steve leans back to show his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mrs. Shan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi, Steve. I thought you were, Darren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys got everything in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself. She sets her PURSE down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's okay... She's been working a lot lately. A little frown of concern crosses Darren's mom. Something about Steve... His mom... He brings out a bottle of soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasses are up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Darren's mom exits as Steve pulls down two glasses, start pour soda. As he waits for the foam to settle, he sees... The purse. Just there. A quick look around, it doesn't ta him long to decide. Steve steps over, opens the purse. A quick rifling finds a wallet: $200 in $20's. He peels o three bills, shoves them in his pocket. BLLEEEP! A cell phone starts going off in the purse. Fumbling, frantic, Steve stuffs the rest of the money back in the wallet, the wallet back in the purse, closes the purse -- Darren's Mom is back in. She's hurrying to get to her celiphone, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? .it takes her a second to realize something's up. Not listening to her call, she watches Steve grab the two gla and hurry out, leaving the soda bottle on the counter and guilt in the air. As she looks over at her purse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve comes up off the stairs. He sets the glasses on a h table, continues into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's looking through Steve's vampire memorabilia. Ste reaches past, starts packing it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. See ya tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Tonight where? He zips the bag, slings it over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cirque du Freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got no money right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it. I got money. Meet me ten to Midnight. The Zeiterion Theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That place is supposed to be haunted. Steve rolls his eyes, starts out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to tell my parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them you're sleeping over. We can meet early, walk over together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D, it's Cirque du Freak. You wanna hear about it Monday? Or see it tonight? Steve lets his point sink in, then goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Annie and his mom and DAD eat dinner. Annie chatters away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why we need a dog. She waits for an answer. Mom and Dad exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you guys decide who's going to say no when you look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever's eyes are the widest. And I didn't say no. Yet. As she tries to think through a new approach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? I'm gonna sleep over Steve's tonight? Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic; no hesitation) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I said so, Darren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fourteen. I shouldn't even have to ask stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is no. And I'm not sure I want you hanging around with Steve anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known him since I was five years old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change and I don't like the way Steve's changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- That's not fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop arguing with her, Darren. Furious at his treatment, Darren gets up, stomps out. As Annie wonders if she should ask what's up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moonlight glinting off Darren's spider terrarium. Darren, under the covers, gets out of bed. Fully dressed. Going to his door, he listens. Then he crosses to the window. Pulling out the screen, he starts to climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren out his second floor bedroom window, starts to cli down via the trellis. CRACK! A section of the trellis BREAKS under his feet. Darren almost falls, catches hold. He pulls himself over, starts down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of a dilapidated, mostly abandoned downtown. Noirish Darren and Steve hurry around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here after your house. There was a van there, guy selling tickets. (holds up tickets) Rest is history. They cross toward the ornate, albeit crumbling facade of ZEITERION THEATER. Deserted, except for a few CANDLES burning on the sidewalk by a door. The wind moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why they closed it, right? Years ago a kid fell out of the balcony and died. It's haunted.
Steve catches himself getting spooked. He shoves Darren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paint peeling. The walls scribbled on. Most of all - it's dark. Darren and Steve head toward a glow coming from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward a light at the end. Darren pauses at a darkened staircase. Headed up. He points it out to Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balcony. Where he fell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you? They wheel around, react to the sight behind them. MR. TA Gaunt, but oozing an elegant toughness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to see the show. He takes an ominous step forward, then holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Ticket. Steve hands it over. Mr. Tall pockets it, looks to Darren

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Do you have your ticket? Darren. Darren starts to hand it over, hesitates. The guy knew hi name. Mr. Tall reaches, takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: This way. We're about to begin. Mr. Tall turns on his heel and strides off. As they follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he heard me say it.
Mr. Tall turns a corner, only steps ahead of them. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they turn it, Mr. Tall is gone. Vanished. Ahead, a threadbare velvet CURTAIN. A low murmur on the other side The boys exchange a last look, then push through into...

dialogues.speaker: THE ZEITERION THEATER
dialogues.text: Mouldings removed, cherubs gouged from the walls of a onc proud theater. Rows of seats are missing as well. Those that remain are filled. The crowd seems nervous, watching the empty stage expectantly. Yearning for something speci No sign of Mr. Tall. Darren and Steve stand at the top of the aisle. The only kids here. Somewhere off stage a TRUMPET sounds and with it a stage light goes out. Steve nudges Darren, points out two empty seats halfway d As they move for them, a second trumpet sounds and a seco stage light goes out. And so on. By the time Darren and Steve take their seats, the theater has gone black. A final flourish from the trumpets and all is silent. Then, a dull green light glows across the stage. Before i was empty; now there is a CAGE, set on wheels, in the cen There's the scraping of chain. A low guttural sound. A white spot shines down, leaves the front half of the ca in light, the back half in shadow. A FIGURE moves in ther The AUDIENCE lean forward, hoping to see when there's a R Several people SCREAM as the figure CRASHES to the front the cage. A WOLFMAN for lack of a better term, its body covered in thick, matted hair. It roars again, shakes the bars. Its half-canine teeth yellow, its eyes red. A chain hangs attached to an iron collar around its neck. Half the audience believe it's real. The other half are amazed at how real this 'performer' seems. As they buzz, Tall steps out on stage. Wearing red leather gloves and h

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen. Welcome to the Cirque du Freak. We are an ancient circus. We have toured for five hundred years...
Darren and Steve exchange a look at this information.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: .Bringing the remarkable and grotesque to generations. Our freaks are not people in masks. They are not harmless misfits. What you see tonight is real. Each performer unique. None harmless. To prove this, the Wolfman lunges, reaches a claw through bars to swipe just centimeters short of Mr. Tall who's no reaction shows he knows exactly where he's standing. A ripple goes through the crowd as they become aware of TRUSKA. Startlingly beautiful. Dressed for the Moulin Rouge. Crossing the stage in a languid catwalk. Several M in the audience begin to cough and shift in their seats. Even the Wolfman takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Beauty and the beast. Truska approaches the cage, makes soothing motions, her u body swaying. The Wolfman lulls to a trance. Two stage hands - MIDGETS apparently, hidden by blue robe step out and start to push the cage off stage. Truska steps toward the audience, moving in the same languorous rhythm. And then: she begins to grow a BEARD. Hairs creeping from above her lip, curling from her chin. Some in the audience recoil. Darren and Steve trade grins. This is great. Then... From either wing of the stage come twin contortionists: S & SERSA. They walk on their hands, their legs pulled with their ankles cinched behind there necks. As Truska exits, Sive and Sersa meet in the middle. Like Hindu wrestlers they take turns, climbing up and down eac other, look like one person with two fronts. They twist l pretzels, getting huge LAUGHS when they pretend to be stu As it goes on, RHAMUS TWOBELLIES pads out to watch. The floorboards creak under his feet. He must weigh 600 pound After a moment, he turns, walks toward the audience. The light leaves the contortionists and focuses on Rhamus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Rhamus Twobellies. And I do have two. He TRIPS, stumbles toward the edge of the stage. PEOPLE i the front row jump back to keep from being crushed. Rhamu stops short, LAUGHS at them. He was pretending. He's practically doubled-over, resting his hands on his haunch More blue-robed MIDGETS roll out a CART covered with food lots of other stuff. Rhamus grabs a GLASS BOTTLE of soda. Instead of opening it, he bites off the glass top, chews and swallows. Soon he's eating food almost as fast as he grab it. Disgusting, but great fun at the same time. Next, he holds up a couple of nuts and bolts. Then swallo them whole. He swings his belly around. You can hear the sound of metal shifting inside. The crowd recoils as he starts to regurgitate, spitting o BOLTS, NAILS, BOTTLE CAPS, a JACKKNIFE. They clatter on stage. Finally, a METAL LINK appears between his teeth. He pinches hold of it and pulls. A CHAIN starts out of hi mouth, up from his belly. One foot...two...six feet in al With a shrug he starts off stage, dragging it behind him. Darren & Steve break into applause. So does the audie As Rhamus' chain slides out of sight, a SNAKE slides in. enormous BOA CONSTRICTOR. Impossibly huge. It slithers ou to the center of the stage, its tongue flicking in and ou A SPOTLIGHT flicks down from above. The snake stops, rais itself several feet off the ground as it looks up, seemin transfixed by the light. But in reality... The end of a thick ROPE drops down. And moving (headfirst down the rope is a BOY. Very thin, his blonde hair tinged with green. This is EVRA VON. He moves smoothly, twists over backwards to set his feet down on the stage. Evra wears a sort of cloak which he suddenly spins out of The audience GASPS... Wearing only shorts, Evra's body SPARKLES. He's covered in gold, blue and green scales! He moves a vaguely webbed hand through the air, charming snake which raises itself higher still. He slowly slides forward till he and the boa are nearly eye-to-eye. Then Evra leans forward and KISSES the snake on the nose.
DARREN & STEVE DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's as old as us. STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evra starts to make a HISSING sound. In response, the sna begins corkscrewing around him like the stripes on a barb shop pole. Finally, it slithers around his neck, pulls ba to look him in the eye. And then... Evra bends at the knees, lays down and starts to roll. Li he was wrapped in a snake carpet, he disappears stage lef More applause from the audience. Then the stage goes dark except for a small focused spot the center. Everyone waits, but nothing happens until... Appearing literally out of nowhere - one instant there's nothing under the spot and the next instant there is --

dialogues.speaker: LARTEN CREPSLEY
dialogues.text: Motionless, looking past the crowd. The only difference f his pictures is he's a bit older and a SCAR runs down his left cheek. It stretches his mouth up on that side. DARREN & STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognize him. Can't believe their eyes. Steve pulls the print-out from his pocket, compares. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him... STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley disappears! The crowd mumble nervously. And just as suddenly he's back! On the edge of the stage, lit by t footlights. This time he holds a draped BIRDCAGE. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true. That all tarantulas are poisonous. Though some can kill a man. With one bite. Crepsley whisks off the covering. In the cage: a TARANTUL the size of a large man's hand. So big you can make out individual eyes. As deadly looking as it is beautiful. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacts. A spider!
STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley makes the introduction. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name? Madam Octa. Pray that she never learns yours. Two of the blue-robed 'little people' lead a GOAT onto th stage. A ripple of worry runs through the crowd. Crepsley starts over. The goat BLEATS. The little people hold it. Mr. Crepsley flicks open the cage door with his finger. T spider sets its front legs on the bars, pulls itself thro A few gasps from the audience. The goat bucks. Madam Octa bares her fangs, poised to leap on her prey. Several audience members CRY OUT that this should stop. Crepsley looks out with mock-theatrical surprise. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...? Shall it be life? Chuckling to himself, he looks to the goat tenders. They release the goat which bee-lines its way off the stage. Crepsley faces the audience. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you would be as shocked to see the same fate for me? Madam Octa moves -- climbing the outside of the cage -- taking a cautious step onto the hand holding the cage, th starting up Crepsley's arm. He stands dead still. DARREN & STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a million questions, but right now the performance h their full edge-of-their-seat attention. STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Octa has nearly reached Crepsley's left shoulder. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though we have been together such a long time, she is no pet. I think she would quite enjoy killing me. Crepsley calmly raises his free hand. It holds a shiny TI WHISTLE. Madam Octa has reaches his shoulder.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For her bite there is no cure. Madam Octa bares her fangs, even longer now. Her malevole about to be directed at her master. Crepsley carefully puts the whistle to his mouth and star to play, as simple as it is evocative. Madam Octa hesitates. Then, she moves around his throat, starts to climb his face using his scar as her guide. She gets to the top of his head, stands in his shock of hair. She sways; she's dancing! Then she leaps, lands on the end of the whistle. Crepsley keeps playing as Madam Octa attaches a web, drops down ab 18 inches off the end. She starts to swing. Crepsley takes the whistle from his mouth and twirls it around. Octa does a few 360s and the thread breaks. She sails up high over Crepsley's head. He cranes back to watch as down she comes, legs splayed. lands flat on his face. The whistle is in his hand. Crepsley looks out at the audience. Looking out between h hairy legs, his eyes are wide with horror. Without warning, the spotlight on him goes out. As the st is plunged into darkness, we hear Crepsley SCREAM. A horrible, horrible sound. The audience wait, but nothin happens. Some of them rise from their seats, peer into th gloom. It's too dark. The sound of something being DRAGGED. Then nothing. A lig comes up stage left as Mr. Tall steps out.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Thank you, ladies and gentlemen. That is the end of our show. AUDIENCE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... What happened to him?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Don't you know? What happens to us all, can happen to any of us. That said, there's a crack of thunder and an explosion seemingly at Mr. Tall's feet. He's nowhere to be seen.
The houselights come up. The stage is empty. Some in the audience start to clap. Others are a bit dismayed. Darren and Steve sit there as people start for the exits. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get outta here. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you go. I'm staying. Steve starts down toward the stage. Darren follows. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. What're you doing? Steve reaches the stage, looks around. The audience is mostly exited; no one from the Cirque is in sight. As Steve starts up onto the stage, Darren grabs his shoul Steve wheels, shoves Darren who stumbles back into a seat STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my destiny. Don't ruin it. Steve looks dangerous as he looms. Darren raises his hand in surrender. Steve eases off, but he's still intense. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That car today. It was a sign. Sending me here. I was told there'd be a sign. Too friggin' weird. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told by who? The guy in the chat room? The internet guy? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you later. If I can. Steve scrambles onto the stage and disappears into the ba Darren stands, whispers into the dark. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve... Decision time. Darren climbs up, starts after his friend. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren moves back into the gloom. Deserted, the junk cast sinister shadows. Then, a sound at his feet. Darren stops short. Sees that he's almost walked into an open stage DO IN THE FLOOR. The sound is someone moving below. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve...? No answer. Darren decides, starts down steep, rickety ste CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: He moves past a dilapidated stage elevator. Stumbles. As heads further into the dark. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming down the creaky stairs. Spooky. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve... CUT TO: STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning a corner, is startled by what turns out to be a costume mannequin. But beyond: a LONG BOX set on two sawhorses. Coffin-sized. Empty, its lid propped up by it. The dust is tracked with footsteps. A mini-FRIDGE hums in corner. Steve steps over, sees an EXTENSION CORD which ru up the wall, disappears into a hole punched in the ceilin DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops short as a LIGHT suddenly cuts through the gloom to left. Darren steps over low behind a CREDENZA. He sees... STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's opened the door to the fridge. The little bulb insid pushes through the gloom, lighting the area up. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacts as MADAM OCTA tries to jump on his face! The bars her CAGE stop her. It rests on the credenza he crouches behind. The whistle is there too. Darren looks over as...
STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches in the fridge, takes out a glass jar that looks t filled with BLOOD. Steve raises it, swirls it around insi CREPSLEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you looking for me? Steve whirls -- drops the bottle -- SMASH! Standing behind him - dead still - CREPSLEY. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooted to the spot. Watching... STEVE & CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crespley sniffs the air - the spilled blood to be exact. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I know who you are. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, boy. Who am I? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a vampire. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too broad a definition. Do you introduce yourself as a human? Who I am is Larten Crepsley. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving slightly to get a clearer view. STEVE & CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley suddenly DISAPPEARS, REAPPEARS much closer. Stev jumps, twists around. Unnerved. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sent you and what do they want? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. No one. Crepsley takes a moment to decide if he believes him. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want?
STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to join you. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join me? I don't understand. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to make me a vampire. Not what Crepsley (or Darren) expected. Steve stands ther trying to look resolved. Crepsley is surprised, intrigued CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because you want to live forever? Because we don't. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about living forever. But you do seem to live a long time. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time alone. Do you want to live alone? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already do. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you an orphan? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father's gone; my mother doesn't care about me. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor mine. You're friendless also? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a friend, but he doesn't understand. He's got too much to know what it's like to be alone. As Darren reacts to this... STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're alone you feel weak. Useless. But I know there must be something strong about it, too. I want to feel the power of being alone. I want to be a vampire.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power of being alone will never be greater than the weakness of it. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Crepsley's actually impressed, but after a moment he wave dismissive hand. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes no matter. We do not blood children. I'm sorry. Steve pulls a JACKKNIFE from his pocket, flips open the 2 inch blade. Crepsley laughs out loud. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you intend to use that on me? And we feel it more than see it, but Steve cuts into his palm. He holds it up, moist and red in Crepsley's face. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Make me a vampire. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not tempt me. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe what he's watching. He sees Crepsley sudden get 'scent' of something. Something to do with Steve's blood. Not quite a clear view as Crepsley grabs Steve's wrist, dabs a finger into his palm and then tastes it. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley shoves Steve down to the ground and immediately begins spitting onto the floor. Like it was poison. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have bad blood. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can taste the menace in your blood. You can never be a vampire. You're evil. Steve scrambles to his feet. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie. You take that back! Crepsley draws himself full, his voice deadly. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home. Suddenly cowed, Steve just stands there blinking. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Steve runs, disappears into the gloom. After a moment, we can hear him scurrying up the stairs. Then he's gone. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen to his spot, watches as Crepsley, seemingly ill, h his head and spits again onto the floor. Then he steps ov and kicks the fridge door closed. And in the blink of an eye, he's gone. Disappeared. Darren is alone. He starts out, then stops. Looks back. That beautiful spider. And Darren takes Madam Octa's cage and the whistle and makes a run for it. Just like that. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 AM. Dead quiet. Darren hurries home, cage in hand. Looking over his shoulder. So far so good. He nearly trip over an untied shoelace. He sets down the cage, to tie it Madam Octa lunges across her cage at a WORM on the sidewa DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You want that? Darren picks up the worm, lowers it between the bars. A b and then Madam Octa snatches it away from him. Dinner.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I'm your friend... You're so beautiful I stopped thinking. The wind rustles. Darren grabs the cage, continues. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house dark. Holding the cage with one hand, Darren starts climbing the side of the house using the other. He avoids the broken section, but as he reaches the window: His Dad is standing there looking out. Busted. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get inside. From his angle, Darren's Dad can't see the cage in his so hand. Darren hooks it over the end piece of part of the trellis and climbs in. Leaving the cage hanging behind. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren stands across from his Dad. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freak show? Are you kidding me? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was down at the old Zeiterion Theater. Look, dad, I'm sorry. It's just, I couldn't resist. I -- DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me the other day you were broke. You were looking for a job to do around the house this weekend. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? So? DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get money for the show? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve had money. Darren's Dad's suspicion is confirmed.
DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve... We weren't going to tell you, but we think Steve stole money from your Mom's purse yesterday. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't do that. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's pretty sure about it. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, what is this? You don't want me hanging around with him. Now you say you think he stole money? Do you know for sure? DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve's had some bad times lately. I'm trying to be a good friend. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being a good friend and sneaking out are two different things. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to sneak out! You treat me like a kid! A moment as Darren's raised voice rings out of the room. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then act like an adult if that's how you want to be treated. This world is crossed by fences -- Darren interrupts. He's heard it a million times. DARKEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. And you gotta decide which side you stand on. And you can't sit on it either. His Dad doesn't enjoy hearing his words thrown back at hi He starts for the door, looks back before exiting. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freak show. What do they do, put people in cages for everyone to laugh at?
Darren feels bad, like a kid. He looks down at the floor. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't like that. A beat. Darren's Dad goes, closing the door. Darren sighs He goes to the window, pulls up the cage. He scans a look outside. Except for his Dad, the coast is clear. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren sets the cage on a shelf, shuts the door. Black. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's Mom making omelettes. Darren's DAD helping, dici up some ham. Annie sits at the table awaiting the results ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he in a lot of trouble? DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing a few years in prison won't take care of. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see what the big deal is... DAD (TO MOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you talk to Steve's mom yet? MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this. She said she couldn't comment because she didn't make it home last night herself. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was she? MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go tell Darren it's breakfast. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: MADAM OCTA
dialogues.text: Seen through the bars of her cage. FREEZE FRAME.
DARREN'S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's just snapped her photo with his DIGITAL CAMERA. As the door bursts open and Annie enters... Darren scramb to block the cage from view. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, you gotta learn to knock. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom said to come eat. What's that? As Annie tries to look, Darren stays in front of her. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out. Annie sighs, heads out. Darren puts the cage in the close CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren arrives, sits as everyone pretends not to notice. mom slides his omelette off the pan into his plate. Annie watches everyone's every move. Darren eats a bite. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, this is the best omelette I ever had. His Dad can't help but smile. Good move. Mom is pleased, but knows she's being manipulated. As Annie stifles a lau Darren shoots her a look. A KNOCK at the kitchen door. Annie gets up, opens the doo to reveal: Steve. From his angle he can only sees Annie. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, midget, where's the idiot? Annie motions Steve in. He stops short when he see everyo else. He recovers, does his best Eddie Haskell... STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Shan, Mrs. Shan. It's nice to see ya. As Steve gets several less than welcoming looks... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Steve enter his bedroom. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Everyone acting like they don't know me. Did I walk in on something? Darren closes the door. Gets to the point. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened last night? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I hung out in the theater for awhile, but no one was around. The lie hangs in the air a moment. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the way I acted. I'm sorry I pushed you. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. There's, you know, no bad blood or anything like that. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said don't worry. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said bad blood. I never heard you say something like that before. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, the word police? Steve gives him a look. A weird tension in the air. Darre glances at the bandage on Steve's palm, changes the topic DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see that new game I got? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... Darren steps over, starts his computer up. While waiting, Steve sees the digital camera on the dresser, picks it up
STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get one of these. Steve switches it on. Something occurs to Darren too late DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that -- On the screen: the PHOTO OF MADAM OCTA. Steve twists arou to keep the camera out of Darren's reach. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Madam Octa. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took it at the show. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar. Look at the background. This got taken right on your desk. Darren's caught. As they just stare at each other. CUT TO: MADAM OCTA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her cage, on the desk. Darren and Steve looking her ov STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do it? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were loading a van outside. I, I just took her. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that... (after a look) You stole from a vampire you know? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because he had a coffin doesn't mean he's really a... Darren trails off. Steve realizes Darren saw the coffin. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were there, weren't you? (NO ANSWER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what he said to me? That I was evil?
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't believe it. Steve studies Darren, hopes that's true. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard what you said to him, too. That you wanted to be a vampire. Steve doesn't want to talk about it. He looks at Madam Oc STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think he made her do what he wanted? Darren opens his desk drawer, pulls out the flute. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew how to play it. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was just for show. I think he used something else. Some kind of mind control. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean telepathy? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet anyone with a brain could do it. Which leaves you out. Steve smiles, gives Darren a little punch in the arm. The tension is loosening. They react to a KNOCK on the door. ANNIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in? Darren goes to the door. Opens it a few inches. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, Annie... ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I knocked. As they talk, Steve opens the cage door. Madam Octa sets arms on the edge, pulls herself out. LEAPS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lands on Steve's shoulder. Her fangs, wet with poison, gl just before she sinks them into Steve's throat. She BITES

Steve surges upward, his shout dying in his throat. He stiffens, eyes snapped wide, and then crumples to the flo Darren and Annie react as -- Madam Octa scurries off, disappears behind the curtain. DARREN (TO ANNIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. Annie freezes. Darren grabs a BASEBALL BAT which leans in the corner. He reaches out, pokes at the curtain with it. Madam Octa drops down onto the window sill -- WHAM! Wood cracks as Darren brings down the bat, but Madam Octa is t quick. She disappears, leaping out the open window! Darren pulls it shut. He rushes back to Steve, turns him over. Steve's skin is already a deathly pale. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve... Annie reaches out, takes Steve's hand. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren, he's freezing. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dad. Go. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital doors BANG OPEN as a gurney bearing Steve is rus through. Darren and his Dad follow with a DOCTOR. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of spider was it? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think some kind of a tarantula. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got away. Darren's Dad holds up the camera.
DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a picture of it. The doctor takes it as a NURSE meets the gurney. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anaphylactic shock. Get Doctor Lund. And we need to download a photo to poison control. This is as far as Darren goes. Steve is wheeled in, surrounded. Syringes are drawn, handed in. All we can see of Steve is one skinny arm hanging out. PUSH IN ON DARREN. Sick for Steve. Scared. Unaware that his world has only just started to crash down around him. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUND
dialogues.text: Tough, no nonsense. Marching along, carrying a print-out, coming to a stop where Darren sits on a plastic chair. He sticks the print-out into his face. The PHOTO of Madam Oc

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUND
dialogues.text: How did you make this and why would you make this? Darren's Mom and Dad start over from down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUND
dialogues.text: Poison control couldn't ID it. In fact, the department of Entomology at Harvard couldn't find it in their data base. So either it's a new species or it's a fake photo. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my son said he took that photo, then that's the truth. Dr. Lund just stares at Darren. Then: WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done to him?! STEVE'S MOM approaches, her eyes on Darren. Disheveled, cheap looking, she hasn't quite started her hangover yet. She lunges past Darren's dad, grabs Darren by the shoulde STEVE'S MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hurt Stevie?! Did you?!
She shakes Darren hard. Darren's Dad gets between them. S breaks down, sobbing. Darren's mom tries to soothe her as she moans about what a bad mother she is.

dialogues.speaker: DR. LUND
dialogues.text: Your friend's going to die unless we find out what's in him. On Darren. He looks down to where light spills out from Steve's room. His friend is going to die in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren as he lays in bed, staring at the ceiling. His clo switches to 2:58 AM. Deciding, Darren gets out of bed. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed, Darren climbs out the window, starts down. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead lonely as Darren approaches, steps up to the glass d As he leans in to look into the lobby, the door gives a little. It's unlocked. Darren pushes it open with a finge CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's by the credenza where he hid. The coffin is gone DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE WITH DARREN who comes up from below and crosses. Sta with him as he parts the curtains and comes out on the... ZEITERION STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he stops short, sees in the center of the stage -- Crepsley's COFFIN. A beat and Darren steps up. He grips t lid, starts sliding it back. He looks inside to see --

Madam Octa perched on the side, staring back at him! Darren stumbles back. The coffin lid SLAMS to the stage a Darren loses his footing, lands on his butt. And then -- APPLAUSE. One pair of hands create a hollow echo. Crepsley sits alone in the middle of the theater. Clappin And then he's gone! Only to reappear over Darren, offerin hand up. Darren scrambles to his feet. A beat. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you come for this time? Darren pulls out a CRUCIFIX, holds it in Crepsley's face. The vampire takes it, looks it over. It has no effect. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crosses don't hurt you? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should they? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... you're evil. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? Are vampire bats evil when they drink the blood of cows? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's different. Bats are animals. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. So are you. Our appetites don't make us evil. (as Darren ponders...) Why are you here? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your spider bit my friend Steve. Crepsley shrugs, tosses Darren back his crucifix. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dying. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, boys who play with things they do not understand can hardly complain if --
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help him! CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antidote to her poison is rare. Expensive. Why should someone as evil as I am waste it on Steve? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay you back. If it takes 50 years. Whatever it costs. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money doesn't interest me. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something you want. That's why you're here waiting for me. Right? Crepsley's surprised and pleased by Darren's intuitivenes CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night Steve came below to speak to me, you were there. Did you hear what we talked about? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to... become like you. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't just 'become' a vampire. The change is too extreme. And if the shock didn't kill you, your inexperience would. So you become one in stages. A half-vampire at first. With greater strength than a human, but still able to go out in sunlight. You learn from a full vampire. Do you understand? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so... CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your friend has bad blood. He's no good. There's no telling what he'll become as he matures. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that someone can have bad blood.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yesterday you didn't believe in vampires. Regardless, I've left the Cirque. Left my protection. I need someone to protect me while I sleep. I need an apprentice. DARREN (SUDDENLY REALIZES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Crepsley nods. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. There's no way. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then your friend will die. The words hang in the air. Crepsley smiles. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hardly have a choice. It's your destiny. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destiny? That doesn't make sense. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try this then. You're reckless enough to steal, responsible enough to come back for a friend. That's enough for me. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, destiny can't be explained. It must be lived. Now, you're wasting my time. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gotta be another way. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... He's my friend.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he slips away while we argue. Life or death? Yes or no? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd never be able to trust me. If I got a chance for payback I'd take it. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no? Thoughts rush, then stop. Darren finally just nods. Crepsley raises his right hand. The nails are not especia long, but they look thick and sharp. Crepsley takes Darren's hand, jabs at his forefinger, dra blood. He dabs off a drop, smells it, then tastes it. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have good blood. Crepsley lifts his own left hand. He presses the nails of his right into the fleshy tips of his left hand fingers. Then he uses the left nails to mark the right fingers in same way. Blood drips down all ten fingers. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift your hands. Darren does as he's told. Crepsley digs all ten nails int all ten of Darren's fingertips. Darren jerks back in pain CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get used to pain. More lies ahead. He motions to his hands. Darren raises them, fingers spre Crepsley presses his fingertips to Darren's. Blood brothe As their eyes lock, Darren frowns at an alien sensation. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood flows into your left arm and out of your right. Do you feel it? Getting near your heart? Darren nods, shivers. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there. A force arcs through Darren's body. He screams, falls dow
Crepsley turns away, starts to lick the blood from his fingertips. Tries to block out Darren's soft whimpering. Tries to block out any sympathy he feels. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world will start to slow down. You'll become a witness of time. (snaps out of it) Your friend's time is running out. He pulls Darren to his feet. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step out into the moonlight. Darren a little wobbly. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my arm. Don't let go. Darren takes hold. Crepsley starts to move. Only it seems more like he's still and the ground is moving under his f Darren looks about as the building begin to streak past, road a blurred ribbon. The night has a weird chromatic lo The world moving faster, Crepsley and Darren slipping pas A moment later and they're in the...

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Crepsley pulls loose Darren's hand. They're still bleedin CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lick your fingers. Vampire spit will stop wounds from bleeding. Darren looks at his fingers, then around the lot. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd we get here? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called flitting. Which room is your friend in? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tubes run in and out of Steve. His breathing is labored.
Crepsley leans over him, rolls up one of Steve's eyelids. Darren watches as Crespley looks into Steve's eye. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in time. He still has a few minutes left. Crepsley takes a small AMBER VIAL from his pocket. He bre a wax seal then pinches out a small blackened cork. He pulls the drip line out of the IV CATHETER and empties drop of the vial's dark, viscous contents inside. It swir murkily, coloring the liquid on its way into Steve's arm. A beat and then Steve seems to convulse, his arms and leg twitching. Is he dying? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was near death. The journey back is not pleasant. What do you know about him, this boy with bad blood? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my friend. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm... Who's his father? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never met him. I don't think Steve ever did either. Why do you want to know? And then Steve comes around. He opens his eyes, focuses o Darren for a moment. He looks puzzled. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren? And then he drifts off, asleep. His breathing growing deeper, steadier. Darren realizing he's going to be okay. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come with me now or do you have things to set in order first? That's when it really hits home. He's agreed to leave eve thing and go off with a vampire. Without really thinking, Darren starts backing toward the door, his eyes on Crepsl
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... Darren's almost to the door. Crepsley stays where he is. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run if you want. It won't help. You're a creature of the night now, Darren Shan. Darren turns and bolts leaving Crepsley alone. Chuckling, the vampire tucks Steve's covers up under his chin. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURSTING OPEN as Darren charges out. Running for his life CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren asleep in his bed. The door opens and his mom ente MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren... Wake up, honey. Darren wakes with a start as she gives him a little shake As he looks about, wonders what reality he's in. MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got off the phone. Great news. Steve's going to be okay. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital says it's a miracle. Was it a dream? Darren looks down at his hands. On the ti of each finger and two thumbs are small round WHITE SCARS Darren instinctively hugs his mom. She thinks he's overjoyed, can't see his look of terror. She hugs him bac MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's great news. I know how you feel. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Darren steps out. He takes a long look and down the street. Nervous. Then he see the sun up in t sky. Relaxes a little. Right... Vampires... Sun. He takes a step down the stairs when... From out of the bushes... SOMEONE LEAPS! ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo! Darren nearly jumps out of his skin. Annie laughs. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you! I finally got you! - Darren turns on her, looks like he could kill her. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever do that again. Annie's smile drops away. As Darren continues on... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren walking along, feeling isolated as he moves past t other students. Everything seems weird, off. A couple of KIDS RUSH past him going into a classroom. Th a COUPLE more coming the other way. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Shan, you gotta see this. They duck into the classroom. Darren follows. SCIENCE LAB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWENTY or so KIDS all pressed around the Boa Constrictor tank. Steve holds court. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Doctor said it was a miracle. They say I'm unique -- Steve spots Darren as he steps up in the back. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Darren. I've been looking for you. We got a lot to talk about.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first... Steve holds out a fist. A MOUSE pokes its head out throug an opening in the hand. Its whiskers twitch. As Darren looks from the mouse to the snake... Steve addresses the kids does his best 'Mr. Tall'. He tri to be entertaining, but he comes off creepy. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Cirque du Steve. What happens to us all can happen to any of us. If you watch, it's by your own free will. Say farewell... HEFTS MOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .to Crepsley the mouse. Darren reacts to the name. Steve lowers his hand into the terrarium. Some kids already look away, others are intent DARREN STOP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve hesitates. Darren pushes to the front. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cruel. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nature. Anyhow don't watch. (TO KIDS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't blink; you might miss it. Steve sets the mouse in the terrarium. The MOUSE takes a few tentative steps. Moves toward a cor away from the... SNAKE who's suddenly alert. It raises it head, flicks its tongue. Coils back on itself. ZAP! The snake STRIKES... And Darren darts down his hand! CATCHES the snake just be its head, out of mid-air, out of mid-strike. Impossible! The snake twists in Darren's hand. The students are blown away. Steve's eyes narrow, his wheels are turning. The BELL RINGS. Moment over. Kids hurry out to class.
Darren scoops up the mouse, drops the snake back in. As h starts out, Steve cuts him off. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the spider? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed it. Steve hesitates, processes, looks Darren over. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dream. You and Crepsley were in my hospital room... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it later. Darren starts away. Steve grabs him hard, spins him aroun STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you now. Darren reacts instinctively, grabs Steve with his free ha and SLAMS him against the wall. Steve's nearly off the ground, only his left toe touching. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said later. Darren lets go, heads off. Steve watches, wonders. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren walks home, hands in pockets. Annie comes up behin ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren! Wait up! He looks over his shoulder, keep going. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I walk home with you? He softens, slows down. After a few silent steps. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you something. Darren pulls the MOUSE from his pocket. Annie loves it, c it in her hand.
ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's adorable. ANNIE & DARREN - A CREATURE'S POV Coming in low and fast. STREET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie SCREAMS as a GERMAN SHEPHERD charges, stops just sh of them. GROWLING like it was rabid. Like it hates Darren Darren steps between it and Annie. Darren's pupils dilate oddly; he curls his lip to show his own teeth. The dog starts to back off.. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. That's King. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not. King's my buddy. ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's King, Darren. It is. Darren realizes it is King. As Darren realizes something' wrong with Darren.. Another growl. From down the street. Darren looks back as a black 1966 LINCOLN prowls through intersection. The one seen at school. It slows, windows blacked out. As it continues, disappears from view... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. As Darren hurries Annie along down the street... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren at the kitchen table doing his math homework. His makes dinner, chopping vegetables at the sink. MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was school today? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual. Sometimes it was boring, sometimes really boring. Darren's mom laughs. Then...
MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch! She drops the knife on the cutting board. A thick drop of BLOOD runs down her finger. Darren flinches at the sight and in that moment we PUNCH his eyes. The PUPILS swirl red; the IRISES flatten and narrow. A dark, ravenous look.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Holding up her finger. Her skin tone receding back into gray, the blood pulsing with red vibrancy. Alive. A targe DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at the blood's seeming siren call. But as he suddenly moves forward, she turns away. Darren stops as she wraps her finger in a paper towel. Sh looks back at him: misunderstands his hunger for concern. MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, honey. I just need a band-aid. Darren looks at his mom's neck. His eyes zero in on a lit blue VEIN PULSING away. She leaves the room to get a band aid. As Darren's horror sinks in... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren looks at his reflection in the MIRROR. Looking for reassurance. He curls his lip, checks his teeth. They loo normal. He reaches out. Trying to reach himself. His hand comes to a stop against the glass. His nails CLI hard against the surface. He scrapes the nail of his forefinger along the glass. It leaves a deep scratch. Darren starts to freak a little. His breath getting ragge He tries to get a hold of himself, looks back in the mirr DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're different... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren walks down an aisle, climbs up onto the empty stag Dark, but Darren moves calmly, like it was noon. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hey! Crepsley appears. Darren turns, sees him. A beat. Crepsle raises his hands to the gloom around them. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkness isn't so scary anymore, is it? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to think it's me that's scary. Crepsley waits to hear more. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only gonna get worse, isn't it? There's no way back, is there? No magic potion to make me human again? Crepsley shakes his head. Darren nods that he understands DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made a deal. I won't run away again. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's neither here nor there, but, I do feel sorry for you. Darren waves it off, doesn't want to hear it. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready then? The night is young. We can make many miles. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just -- My family, I can't let them think I just left them. Or that something happened to me. My mother would... She couldn't... As Darren trails off, Crepsley really does look sympathet CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing for it.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to kill you. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's parents watching CNN. Darren comes in. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed. They say 'good night' to him. Impulsively, Darren kisses dad on the cheek, then does the same to his mom. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you both. I don't say it that much, but I do. Darren's Mom is caught off guard, but happy to hear it. MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We love you, too. Don't we, Tommy? DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we do. Darren looks at them a beat, then smiles, satisfied. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. They watch him go, then exchange looks. DAD (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids. Who knows how they think? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie asleep already. Darren enters, pulls his sister's blanket up, tucks it under her chin. He whispers: DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, knucklehead. If I can ever help you, I will. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren enters to find Crepsley sitting at his desk. He ho a small dark bottle between his fingers (different than t one he gave to Steve). As Crepsley's about to speak... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Off Crepsley's reaction... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my home and I'm never gonna see it again, so don't rush me. Crepsley makes a motion to zip his lips. All the same, he stands, unscrews the bottle as Darren takes a last look around. He takes a PHOTO of his family off the dresser. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold onto this for me, okay? Crepsley takes the photo, offers Darren the bottle in ret Darren sniffs, recoils at the foul smell. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure it will work? Crepsley opens the window. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart will slow down so drastically they won't find a pulse. With the fall from the window, they'll think you're dead. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I break bones? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better. They'll mend in a few days. Vampires don't stay broken for long and it takes a very long fall to kill one. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the funeral home? Won't they embalm me or something? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I have ways of making my thoughts become the thoughts of others. They'll leave you alone.
Crepsley gestures to the window. Knowing the plan, Darren climbs out, his foot resting on the trellis. He looks to ground, back to Crepsley as an odd thought hits him. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's allergic to grass. It's my job to cut the lawn. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a new job now. Drink. Darren steels himself, gulps it down, hands the bottle ba DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is destiny, huh? Tastes like crap. Darren body seizes up. He lets go, but Crepsley grabs him CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your breathing is slowing, your heart as well. Do you feel it? Darren can't answer. He blinks his eyes 'yes' instead. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be aware of what's going on around you. Remember, the grief that you hear will be a release for those who express it. Darren's eyes drift shut. Crepsley lets him go. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren FALLS, crashes through the trellis and thumps into lawn. Crepsley looks down from the window, then disappear CLOSE ON Darren lying face down in the grass. CRICKETS chirp. Beyond, a NEIGHBOR walks his DOG. The dog suddenly turns in the direction of Darren, pulls on its leash. NEIGHBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, come on -- The Neighbor stops short as he sees the body. NEIGHBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Hey, kid -- He rolls Darren over, realizes something is very wrong.

We stay on Darren, the dog sniffing at him as the neighbo disappears toward the front door. We hear his fist pound. moment later, Darren's father is there. He looks at Darre up to the open window, realizes he fell. An instant later he's on his knees, cradling his son. DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren? Darren! A moment later his Mom... MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren! Oh my God! We're still on Darren's face, his eye open a slit. DARREN'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents hovering over him in despair. The STARS TWINK The neighbor leans in. NEIGHBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's body on a stainless steel table. The MEDICAL EXAMINER shakes his head sadly, looks to his ASSISTANT. MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause of death is trauma from the impact of the fall. Poor kid. ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we doing an autopsy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveals Crepsley watching from around a darkened corner. CREPSLEY (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on a child. Immediately... MEDICAL EXAMINER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to cut open a kid. Not when I don't have to. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren in his coffin, wearing a suit. Aware as... Friends and family passing by. The sounds of people cryin TWO CUTE GIRLS from school lean in. GIRL ONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still cute. GIRL TWO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always had a crush on him. The Goalie from school soccer is next. He holds a little SOCCER BALL in his hand. Tucks it into the coffin. GOALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the next life, Shan. Top right corner every time. Annie steps up, gently strokes her brother's cheek. Then suddenly overwhelmed, she buries her face in their Dad's chest. He leans in tenderly over his son. Choked up: DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Darren. You said it the other night; I didn't say it back. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE leave. Visiting hours are over. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DARREN IN HIS COFFIN
dialogues.text: A hand reaches down, a thumb opens his eyelid. DARREN'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the ceiling for a moment, then a blinding light flashi back and forth. Then glimpses of Steve's face! VISITING ROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve holds Darren's eye open, shines a PENLIGHT into it. The pupil doesn't dilate. Footsteps approach. Steve switches it off, pockets it as the FUNERAL DIRECTOR enter
DIRECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I know it's difficult, but visiting hours are over. Steve nods sadly, looks to Darren. He pats one of Darren' hands which are folded across his chest. In reality Steve checks Darren's fingertips. A WHITE SCAR the end of each one. Steve's crazy idea may be confirmed. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's coffin is lowered into the ground. MINISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashes to ashes, dust to dust, in sure and certain hope of the resurrection to come... Darren's Dad tosses a handful of earth down onto the coff CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid an inch from his face. His eyelid twitching as we hear shovelfuls of dirt hit the lid. The sound growing duller at each turn. Then, as Darren's eye flickers open. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonless. The sound of digging continues. Only now, dirt coming out of the hole rather than going in. Crepsley is digging the coffin back up. Effortlessly. Finally, he spreads his feet apart, pulls open the lid. Darren sputters as some of the dirt spills onto his face. Crepsley reaches down, pulls him up and out of the grave. Darren sits on the ground, coughing then moaning. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your feet. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My legs are asleep.
Crepsley pulls him up anyhow. Darren stumbles a few steps nearly falls before finding his balance. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk it off. I'll fill this back in. Go. Breathe some air. Crepsley closes the coffin, begins to fill the hole as Da ambles off. Not exactly the start of his best day.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE WITH DARREN
dialogues.text: Passing among the graves, stretching his arms, twisting. Really beat up. He looks about, the names and dates on th headstones popping into focus even from far away. Night vision. Suddenly he becomes aware of something: Steve. On the other side of a mausoleum. Ten feet away. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles; closing in) Vampire hunting. Steve rushes the last step, a jagged WOODEN STAKE held hi over his head. He knocks Darren back on the ground. Pouncing on top, he brings down the stake. Darren catches hold of Steve's wrist. Stops the point of stake just over his heart.
