Steve puts his weight into it. desperate moment of struggle, but Darren's strength is resurgent. He throws Steve off. Steve rolls to his feet, comes at him again. Darren catch his wrist with one hand, his throat with the other. He sl him up against the mausoleum, holds him there. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have against vampires? You wanted to become one yourself. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wanted to, but you did. You stole my dream. You stole my destiny. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? I did it to save your life. That was the deal. Me for you.
STEVE (UNHINGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar. You told him I was evil. You planned this all along. And you'll pay! You'll pay -- Darren jams the stake under Steve's throat. That stops hi struggling. The points jabs him as he swallows. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to leave... Steve is just beginning to realize how strong Darren is n DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to leave and forget you ever saw me. Understand? Scared, he nods. Darren shoves him away, brakes the stake two. Steve heads away, looks back over his shoulder. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to hunt you, Darren. You and the other one. Crepsley. I'll put a stake in you and burn you to ashes. I'll make sure you never come back from the grave again. WHAM. Steve walks right into Crepsley. He picks Steve up the shoulders, pulls him close. With a voice like Death.. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we ever meet again, I will show you loneliness you cannot imagine. Steve trembles in fear. Crepsley lets go. Steve takes off running. Crepsley looks to Darren. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still question his blood? Darrenthoughtful, doesn't know what to think. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would a stake through the heart kill a vampire? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But so would getting hit by a truck if it was going fast enough. Steve finally disappears from sight. Crepsley sighs.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be trouble before it's over. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before what's over? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This adventure we're on. Shall we start? Darren hesitates, looks to the twinkling lights of his ci CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get used to it after awhile. Vampires are always saying goodbye. A beat, then Darren looks back at him. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. CUT TO: THE SUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it blisters up into, then rises above the horizon. Sunrise. Ominous if you're a full vampire. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the edge of the highway. Silhouetted against the sun. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren jams a rolled towel along the bottom of a closed d DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that? Dark enough? CREPLEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the other side) Better. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sunrise. CREPLEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the time. I know more about the sunrise than anyone alive.
Crespley sounds irritated. Darren gets mischievous. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll wait until noon and then open every door and curtain in the place. A long tense silence as Darren awaits Crepsley's reply. MOTEL BEDROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley is a shadow among the shadows. He climbs into be CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sunlight would kill me. My electrons are different than a human's. But it would take several hours of exposure. I'd have plenty of time to kill you before I closed the curtains and went back to bed. Crepsley pulls the blanket up over his head.

dialogues.speaker: MOTEL LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: As Darren considers this... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Darren doing pull-ups, a hand on either side of the top j DARREN
It's almost effortless. Bored rather than tired, Darren drops to his feet. (He still wears his burial suit.) CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren watching the cars go by on the highway, spots... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minnesota... Darren jots this state down on a LIST he's keeping. About twenty state license plates so far. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV droning. Darren asleep. Bathed in a golden glow that flickers out as the sun sets. The bedroom door opens. Crepsley steps over, looks down at his snoozing assistant Crepsley CLAPS his hands together, nearly against Darren' ear. Crepsley smiles as Darren jolts awake. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting late, stores closing. The parking lot nearly empt Darren and Crepsley are on a walk and talk. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can die violently. Accidentally or otherwise. But we also grow old. A full vampire will age one year for every ten human years he's alive. A half-vampire like you: one for every five. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was born in 1774. I became -- Crepsley looks back to where Darren has stopped short. DARREN
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we do the math or not? Darren nods. Crepsley motions him to keep up. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I became a vampire when I was 20 years old. In 1794. DARREN
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Paris. The days of the Terror. Heads in baskets. Guillotines up and down all day. Really when humans put their minds to it, we vampires can hardly compete.
Darren's stare jogs him back from the good old days. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Math. 1794. So I've been a vampire now for 211 years. Hmm? Darren nods again, still with him. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I age 1 year for every 10, so, 211 divided by 10, I've aged about 21 years in that time. That 21 plus my first human 20 makes me look about 40. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But altogether you're 211 plus 20. You're really 231 years old. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. You're going to be a teenager for a very long time. They walk on a few steps as Darren thinks this over. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you keep your car anyhow? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What car? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you were driving around my town in. The old black one. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never owned a car, Darren. I don't need one. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was near school one day. It followed me home a few days later. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you saw me behind the wheel? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't see who was driving. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me. As Darren considers this, Crepsley stops suddenly.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There... Ahead: just more parking lot. A WOMAN exiting a BOOKSTORE DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman nears her car. A chirp as she unlocks it with h remote. She opens the back door, sets the book bag on the seat. Suddenly she turns, like someone called her name. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Only nobody's there. She shrugs it off, closes the back door. But hesitates at the driver's side door. Then she starts walking away, toward a back area of loading docks. CUT TO: DARREN & CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch from a dumpster by the loading dock. She walks righ toward them. One look at Crepsley's face and we know he m be willing her over. Darren looks terrified. But the air shimmers and Crepsley has disappeared. The woman steps up, stops across from Darren. As she frow tries to figure out who he is and how she got here... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Run. But Crepsley appears beside her. He 'breathes' into his hand, 'guides' the air into her face. He catches her as s passes out. Darren is horrified. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill her? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put her to sleep. She'll be like this 15 minutes. When she wakes up, she won't remember a thing.
Crepsley eases her to the ground, finds a vein on her wri DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will she become a vampire? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She'd have to share y blood for that to happen. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take too much. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vampire who feeds often can control himself. One who drinks only when he must can end up feeding wildly. He uses one of his fingernails to open the vein. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunger inside us must be fed to be controlled. To be civilized. It's what separates us from... the others. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What others? But as blood oozes, he takes the woman's wrist td his mou Darren is repulsed, but can't look away. Crepsley takes a few deep swallows, then holds the wrist out to Darren. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I won't. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never do it. Crepsley runs his tongue over the cut, rubs the saliva in CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can lead a vampire to blood, but you can't make him drink. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only half-vampire.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter, you need blood to live now. You'll drink eventually. When you're hungry enough. The wrist is clean, the cut gone. A barely perceptible sc DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll die first. CREPSLEY (ANGER FLASHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. You may abstain tonight, but you must feed soon. Crepsley stands to go, then stops short. Tense, he looks about, more hunted animal than man. As he shrugs it off. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? As the woman starts to stir... CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Let's go. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something out there scares you. What is it? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thought of spending another minute with you. Crepsley turns and walks, but Darren's right. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS sets a juicy BURGER down across from Darren. Crepsley sits across from him. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still need to eat food, too. I just don't need it tonight. Darren just sits there. Silently as tears begin to run do his cheeks. Crepsley is exasperated. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood... I wanted it. I wanted to drink it. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you did! You're a Crepsley catches himself. He is not without some compassi CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It was wrong of me to blood you. You're too young. But it's done. Like the entire history of the world up to this moment. Darren quietly cries. Crepsley pulls two paper napkins fr the dispenser, hands them to him. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Darren turns to face the window as he wipes his eyes, nos Then he sees it: parked across and down the street... A black 1966 Lincoln Continental. Darren looks back at Crepsley. CREPSLEY (RE: HAMBURGER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat. Let's not waste anymore food tonight. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car... Crepsley follows the finger as Darren points. DING DING! The bell over the diner door rings...

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: As he looks back over his shoulder at the door. DARREN'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. TINY comes through the front door pimpin'. Peter Lorr on steroids. Scary, done up like a Las Vegas high roller. TABLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren knows trouble when he sees it. He looks back at Crepsley, but the vampire is gone! Vanished.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: (STEPPING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren Shan, we meet at last. Darren just looks up at him. The guy is practically leaki nastiness no matter how avuncular he tries to be.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: You're quite a boy. Sacrificed everything to save a friend. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: A little bat told me. Mr. Tiny takes a french fry off Darren's plate, eats it. Darren looks around. Where the hell did Crepsley go at a time like this? Mr. Tiny knows what he's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Oh, he's still here. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Crepsley. Trying to stay alive. It's so quiet around them Darren can hear a clock TICKING It's a heart shaped POCKET WATCH Mr. Tiny holds on a chai

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Would you like to see? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what? The air seems to buzz as something 'passes'.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Why the fight of course. Boys like to watch fights, don't they? Mr. Tiny hefts his watch. It almost seems to melt into hi palm. As he pulls the winding knob out with a CLICK... As Darren and Mr. Tiny blink out, disappear from the boot CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Mr. Tiny reappear in the booth, but the restaurant's patrons are slowed to near motionlessness.A battle royal going on. Crepsley fighting three VAMPANEZE. All three are sinewy, whipcords with blotchy purple skin. Crepsley stands surrounded in the middle of the restauran Whirling, hand fighting. Blocking their thrusts and blows Darren moves to stand. Mr. Tiny pushes him back to his se Crepsley takes one down with a violent leg whip. He drive the second one back into the third knocking both back. A look to Darren and then he's back on LEG WHIP who's get to his feet. Crepsley drives his flat hand forward, his nails tearing into the vampaneze's throat. As leg whip's hand instinctively goes to his throat to st the blood, Crepsley grabs his free hand, sends him airbor CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As leg whip 'unflits'. The patrons react to him soaring o the counter, slamming into the wall -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrons near frozen again. Leg whip sliding ever so slowly down the wall. Crepsley and Sinewy One & Two F at full speed. Sinewy One pulls Crepsley's arm up behind his back. Creps HOWLING as we hear the bone BREAK. Mr. Tiny grabs Darren by the wrist, pulls him toward the door. Behind them... Crepsley drives the back of his head into Sinewy One's fa at the same time as Sinewy Two swings in his open palm... Sinewy One releases Crepsley who disappears as Sinewy Two slices open Sinewy One's throat. As Mr. Tiny pulls Darren out the door... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley appears. Leg Whip hits the floor. Blood splashes the wall as Sinewy One appears, dropping to his knees. As Leg Whip stands, Crepsley charges, 'shoulders' him hal through the wall. Patrons SCREAM, react, scatter. As Crepsley grabs a knife... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren struggles as Mr. Tiny pulls him along. Behind, through the diner windows, WE SEE Patrons frozen in fligh Sinewy Two near frozen in fight with Crepsley who is in m swing with the knife in his head. Mr. Tiny and Darren stop across from YOUNG MURLOUGH. Humanoid in shape, monstrous in visage. Bloated, his skin albino white with purplish mottling and red crisscrossing veins. He must weigh 300 pounds, but NFL nose tackle styl MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell the blood. The lovely blood. His eyes narrow at the sight of Crepsley, his mouth widen to show two rows of sharp filthy teeth. Darren needs to do something. He eyes the watch in Mr. Tiny's hand. He grabs it with his free hand, thumbs back the winding knob. As Murlough disappears from view... The WINDOW EXPLODES as Sinewy Two hurtles out. Darren tosses the watch high in the air. Mr. Tiny release him to move to catch it. Darren rushes back toward the restaurant. Mr. Tiny catches his watch. Crepsley meets Darren. Crepsley's broken arm hangs useles from his side. Murlough appears alongside. He grabs Crepsley by the thro lifts him off the ground. Crepsley arcs the knife into Murlough's shoulder. Murlough staggers, lets go.
Crepsley takes Darren's hand and they flit, disappearing. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the hamburger joint. The world beginning to streak past them. The asphalt begins to blur beneath their feet, passing cars like they were standing still. But Crepsley heaves for breath. In pain. Darren looks back over his shoulder... DARREN'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough follows. Closing ground. DARREN & CREPSLEY DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's behind us! Crepsley bears down, the buildings streaking by. But... MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closes regardless, relentless, death in his eyes. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost out of gas. But looking ahead. Clocks in an instan a RED LIGHT AHEAD. Cars STOPPED. A CAR FROZEN having just crossed the INTERSECTION. HEADLIGHTS from a blind corner. Crepsley slows. Just as Murlough's about to catch him fro behind... Crepsley comes out of flit mode, disappears. As Murlough FADES after him. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Crepsley appear on the far side of the crossin Murlough comes out of flit in the center. WHAM! The headlights Crepsley saw frozen, but coming from the blind corner, become a PICK-UP - broadsiding Murlough He goes up over the hood, SMASHES against the windshield. As Darren and Murlough disappear again...

The pick-up brakes. Murlough doesn't. He tumbles off the hood, sprawls hard into and skids along the street. A beat and he rolls to a sitting position, looks around. Crepsley in sight. Blood runs out of one of his ears. As wipes it, smearing it across his cheek... PICK-UP DRIVER (RUSHING OVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, are you okay?! He stops short when he sees Murlough's face. Murlough stands, SWATS the driver aside. The Lincoln screeches to a halt alongside him. Murlough climbs in. The Lincoln tearing away. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky getting lighter. A SIGN: Now Entering Pennsylvani The air shimmers as something flits past... WHOOOSHH! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boarded up. Abandoned. Clutching his arm, Mr. Crepsley kicks at the door, splinters it. Opens"a gap. Darren reaches through, unlocks it. As they step inside, the fir rays of the sun appear through the trees. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley climbs down a few steps, closes the door behind Barely any light, but some. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find a blanket. A rug. Cover it. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren drags a CARPET over the root cellar door in the fl ROOT CELLAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes black except for a glint in Crepsley's eyes. He sighs, settles down on the ground. Worn out.
DARREN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My arm's broken. But it should be fine in a day or two.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOLLOWING
dialogues.text: Sunlight fills the kitchen. Darren sits, exhausted. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were they? Vampires? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The one with the watch was Mr. Tiny. Very dangerous. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dangerous can a man named Mr. Tiny be? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said he was a man? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is he? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tiny can't be explained. He needs to be experienced. DARREN (FRUSTRATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the purple guy. What was he? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vampaneze. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Keep talking. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long ago humans were looked upon as animals by some vampires. Cattle to be slaughtered. Laws were passed to forbid needless killing. It made it easier to pass unnoticed among humans if we didn't murder them. Most vampires obeyed... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But some didn't?
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy vampires broke away, declared themselves a separate race. The Vampaneze. Over time their appearance changed, their numbers grew. They believe it's wrong to feed from a human without killing it. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's crazy. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They believe those of us who feed in small amounts live like leeches. In shame. It led to war. Crepsley touches the scar on his face, remembers. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last one nearly destroyed us all. There's been a truce for many years now. (A BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be alright while I sleep? Darren looks around at the dilapidated crap heap he's in. he tries to hold his heart together... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... This is so much better than where I used to be... Crepsley hears the strain in his voice. Knows what's best for both of them.. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of rejoining the Cirque du Freak? Until you get on your vampire feet so to speak. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half vampire. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Three-eighths if you want. What do you think? As Darren thinks... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cirque is camped by an ABANDONED FACTORY. Neo-Gothic scale and mood. Lit up for a performance. Mr. Tall, pulls on his jacket, shouts orders.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Show time in twenty minutes. Someone tell Rhamus to get his stomachs in gear! He's surprised to see Crepsley and Darren walk up the roa Crepsley's arm seems much better now.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Larten'Crepsley! As I live and breathe. I thought it would be years before I saw you again. Mr. Tall looks to Darren, throws a surprised look to Crepsley. Crepsley nods. 'Yes'.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Darren Shan. You've come a long way since the last time I saw you. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked it better where I was.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: I'm sure. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still have my coffin?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Of course. You're really back? (CREPSLEY NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you could do the show tonight? A few of us are absent or ill this evening. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be delighted.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Mr. Shan will have to pull his weight as well. I'll give him to Evra. Evra! EVRA! (LOOKING ABOUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I haven't gone from one unreliable boy to two.
Evra arrives. The snake boy from the first Cirque show.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Evra, my industrious wonder. Here is Darren. Put him to work with you. Show him the snakey ropes. As the two boys consider each other...

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Off with you. Go! As the boys head off, Mr. Tall looks over at Crepsley.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: You blooded a child, Larten? What were you thinking? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't approve?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: I don't matter. What will the vampire generals say when they hear about it? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no longer part of their domain.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: So you say. They may disagree. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Darren and Evra make their way through. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do? Me? I'm a snake boy. I do a whole snake thing. Evra goes into a slithery snake walk for a few steps to illustrate. It's strange. Funny. Evra looks back over. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you eat mice? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Macs actually. They share a LAUGH. Evra 'high fives' Darren. Fast friend
As they continue, Darren looks at the palm of his hand. A few of Evra's SCALES have come off and are stuck there. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I caught your act in the last town. Pretty cool. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'm not doing it tonight. My snake caught a cold. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snakes can catch cold? Evra nods, then SNEEZES himself. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still gotta work the floor though. Ushers. We get the seats filled. They pass PEOPLE all hurriedly crossing the camp. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they all? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backbone of Cirque du Freak. They do the driving, the tent pitching, the potato peeling even. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they end up here? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most wandered in. If Mr. Tall likes them, they stay. Darren's eye is caught by the WOLFMAN. He's being pushed toward the factory building by several of the blue-robed LITTLE PEOPLE. The wolfman's yellow eyes are on Darren as rumbles a low, guttural growl. Darren is so taken that he almost walks into... Madam Truska. He stops short. In costume, beardless, even more beautiful than when we first saw her. She considers Darren, uses a finger to raise his chin. She shakes her head, smiles. As she continues... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd setting, but it works well. Stripped, ragged, weir Feels like a rave. The lighting dramatic, the concrete wa ominous. PATRONS take their seat around a stage. A buzz i the air. DEBBIE & SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the same age as Darren and Evra, they're here for t show. Debbie is self-assured. Sam is sarcastic to cover h insecurities. Right now it's hard to find a seat. And here are Darren and Evra. Evra looking cool in his gr sharkskin, Darren still wearing his burial suit. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we help you find a seat? DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there any left? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the best seats in the house. He leads them a few steps over toward a column. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are with the Cirque? Darren nods. Sam's a little sarcastic and skeptical. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cirque is French, right? Are you guys French? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui. Vous etes observateur. Nous sommes les serpents frangais. That slows Sam a beat. Evra points out a small platform eight feet up the column. You have to climb a natural re- ladder to get there. Sam looks dubious, but Debbie smiles DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool... I'm Debbie, this is Sam. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evra Von. She looks at Darren, waiting.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm Darren. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the show great? Say yes. We had to sneak out to see it. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I snuck out to see it once, too. And I'm still here. An odd, almost spooky moment. Is he serious? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, Darren. Hey. Debbie and Darren. Like Bonnie and Clyde. And their friend Evra Von what? That breaks the moment. Debbie starts climbing the re-bar Sam looks Darren over a beat, picks a thread off his lape SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it looks like the kind of suit you'd wear to a funeral. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea... Evra smiles, sticks out his tongue. Pointy, narrow, Evra sends it up his own nostril. Sam tries to smile, then sta up after Debbie. Freaked out. As Darren and Evra laugh... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tall under a spotlight. Back in his red hat and glove

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Cirque du Freak. We are an ancient circus. Bringing the remarkable to generations... BACK ROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Evra watch from the back, whisper to each othe DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known Mr. Tall? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you meet someone like him? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raised in a circus, but not a nice one like this. The owner used to beat me and keep me in a glass cage. I felt like a useless freak. One night I looked out of my cage and saw Mr. Tall just standing there. He watched me until the owner came over and asked if he could help him. Mr. Tall grabbed him by the throat and strangled him to death. Then he opened the cage and said, "Let's go, Evra." He named me that. I added the Von. I've been with him ever since. Darren looks back at Mr. Tall with a new set of eyes. CREPSLEY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren... Darren turns. Crepsley's back there in the shadows. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about show business? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience reacts as Crepsley 'appears' on the empty st CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be poisoned by a spider may be my fate. It's Darren's cue. Looking appropriate in his burial suit he walks out carrying Madam Octa's cage at arm's length. DEBBIE & SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she realizes it's Darren. Cool. STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren sees Debbie who gives a little wave. As he smiles. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look glum... Miserable...

Darren loses the grin. Crepsley opens the cage. Madam Oct steps to the opening. Crespley raises the flute, plays. Madam Octa walks out and up to Darren's shoulder where sh attaches a web thread. The audience react as she leaps to Crepsley's shoulder and attaches the other end. She dance across to the music, spinning a web as she goes. Darren looks out, sees how much Debbie enjoys it. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set against the black sky. Sparks rise up, their source unknown. All very mysterious until... LAUGHTER. Lots of it. Borderline raucous. We follow the sparks DOWN to... A BONFIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blazing in the Cirque campgrounds. The freaks are eating, drinking wine, relaxing after the show. Like a gypsy camp Mr. Tall sits with his long legs up on a box, really enjo watching everyone else enjoy themselves. Evra munches on a sausage he grills on the end of a stick Darren is all ears and eyes. He likes these people. And he's certainly never experienced anything like this. Someone starts to play a guitar, someone else beats a dru Madam Truska starts to dance, the fire flickering against as are all eyes. Then she reaches out, takes Crepsley by hand. A few moments later, the two of them are engaged in mad TANGO. It takes the camp's collective breath away. Even Darren can't help but enjoy it. Crepsley's arm gives him a twinge or two, but only Truska notices. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mattress on the floor inside. Using tape and cardboard, Darren 'blacks out' the windows. Crepsley steps over. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done. Crepsley looks to the sky. Still dark. The moon setting. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren... (Darren looks over) (MORE)
CREPSLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to sleep here. We'll find a nook in the factory. Crepsley starts off. Darren starts to follow. CRESPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattress. Darren sighs, goes back to the van to retrieve the mattre He starts to pull it out, then stops, nearly doubled over Concerned, Crepsley steps over. Darren waves him off, straightens as whatever it was passes. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just felt sick for a second. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need blood. Darren gives him a dirty look, grabs the mattress. They start walking toward the factory. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHADOWS of a loading dock. Crepsley and Darren approa DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Mr. Tiny might come? Crepsley shrugs, doesn't answer. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he? What does he want? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we want is who we are, don't you think? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you give me a straight answer just once?! CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't learn by me telling you. You must live some things to know what they are. Darren sighs in deep frustration. Crepsley has a thought. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Why do you like spiders?
Darren tires to figure what he's getting at? Implying? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever think there was a particular reason? It seems Crepsley knows the answer even if Darren doesn't DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I never thought about it. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the trouble with children. They don't think about things. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a child. Theystop by the shadows. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a man? If you're not a man, you're a child. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in between. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In between does not exist! The words echo a moment. Darren no closer to understandin CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll sleep in here tonight. But sit outside the van tomorrow and make it look like I'm there. It's just caution. Old habits die hard. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And old vampires? Without a sound, someone has reached around the two of th from behind, a RAZOR-KNIFE held to each of their throats. They stand dead still. We can make out the shape of a hea as whoever it is leans in ever so slightly from the dark. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavner Purl, as always I heard you coming from a mile away. CLICK! In his hand by his side, Mr. Crepsley holds a thin SWITCHBLADE. He presses the steel back ever so slightly.
VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll call it a draw then. The 'voice' pulls back his knives, steps out. It's GAVNER PURL. He was once handsome, but those days are long gone. His face is crossed with scars. They vary in size, thickn and color. Gavner is a warrior, carries himself so. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been too long, Larten. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decades now. They embrace. Darren's trying to catch up. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are friends? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose. We once shared a coffin together. For six months. DARREN (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like roommates? To save money? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were being hunted. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was hunting you? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Darren, Gavner Purl. Gavner extends his hand to shake. Darren sees'the scars o Gavner Purl's fingertips. Darren raises his own hand so Gavner can see his scars. Gavner looks at Crepsley. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-vampire? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. We don't make full vampires of our assistants. Gavner Purl looks at Crepsley, stunned. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor do we make assistants of children. (MORE)
GAVNER PURL (cont'd) (LOSING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child, Larten? Why?! CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my reasons. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they are? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't owe answers to vampires anymore. I'm exiled from our kind GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self-exiled. And I at least am owed an answer. There's a personal history being called upon here. Crepsl is well aware. Darren again is left out. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I care to say is a boy sought me out, knew who I was. He asked me to make him my assistant. Gavner looks to Darren, suspicious. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how did you know -- CREPSLEY (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't Darren. Another boy. His blood was bad. I should have killed him, but I didn't. Darren reacts. Gavner considers it all. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met Darren shortly after. His blood was good or I certainly would have killed him. Darren reacts again. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could a boy find you? Crepsley shrugs. Of course he had help. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny?
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill us. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill me. What he wanted with you wasn't determined. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you chose the wrong boy. In Mr. Tiny's eyes. A moment as they consider the unspoken implications. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys talking about!? No answer as Crepsley and Gavner lock each other in a loo CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's important enough to track down an exile? What is your news? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in your wars. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the other side is interested or they wouldn't be trying to get rid of you. Crepsley gets suddenly very angry. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough killing! No more! You've come to the wrong place. I am the wrong place... Gavner raises his hands in surrender. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even so, I'm glad you're alive. CREPSLEY (RELENTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is coming. Will you stay? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can still make miles. The war won't wait. And neither will bad news. I have to go.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then travel safely. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind if I walk a bit with your assistant? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him with you if you want. He's of little use to me. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Gavner Purl walk. Gavner looks him over. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look sick. Doesn't Larten feed you? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't drink blood if that's what you mean. I promised myself. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get insulted. As Gavner waits for Darren to tell him... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid if I drink blood, I'll become evil. Gavner LAUGHS out loud, catches himself. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing drinking blood will do to you is keep you alive. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how it would start. I would swear it was just to stay alive. But what'll I turn into? You're on one side of the fence or the other. My father used to say that and now I know what he meant. The 'father part' chokes Darren up a bit.
GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already turned, Darren. You need to accept what you've already become. There's no going back. They walk in silence a moment. Then: DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did Crepsley make himself an exile anyhow? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was tired of all the killing. We were at war. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the vampaneze? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley was once a Vampire General. One of our great leaders. He may seem reluctant, but I assure you, no one is as skilled at killing vampaneze than Crepsley is. I think that's why they'd like to get him out of the way. Kill him off before the new war starts. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've known him a long time? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was his assistant. He blooded me, as he blooded you. There's almost something comforting in this news. Gavner Purl so proud and strong looking. Darren wants to know... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd he choose you? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To teach me to kill vampaneze. Up until now, it's the only reason he ever chooses anyone. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it why he chose me? Gavner hesitates, not sure.
GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for Crepsley to say. Not me. Another brick wall, but Darren accepts it. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what the biggest danger is to a vampire, Darren? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampaneze? Mr. Tiny? GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's that they live so long they no longer care. Everything they love is left behind until they finally have nothing left to live for. Except death. The fact that he's taken an apprentice seems, to me, a good sign. A sign that he's thinking of living not dying. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for me. Glad I could help. All the same Darren considers what he's heard. Gavner, meanwhile, considers the open countryside ahead. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clear run. Good. Gavner gives Darren one last appraising look. GAVNER PURL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay by him, Darren. Stay by him. Gavner takes a deep breath. The air around him shimmers, image bouncing in and out of phase like an electron heati up. And then he's gone. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That part is definitely cool. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High in the noon sky. PAN DOWN to where Darren stands und a tree by the old van. He concentrates, looks himself ove Nothing. He concentrates again. He's trying to flit.
Very briefly -- the air shimmers around him -- then stops He looks at his arms. Little WISPS of smoke come off them EVRA (ARRIVING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. EVRA (SNIFFS AIR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's smells like burnt hair. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. I'm congested. (SEES SOMETHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Evra follows his gaze, turns just in time to see: THEIR POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Sam ducking inside the factory. DARREN & EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exchange a look. Start after them. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the show was the night before. Light streams down f gaps in the decrepit roof. No sight of Debbie and Sam as Darren and Evra make their way in.- They pause at a CREAK coming from somewhere overhead. As they move... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Evra come off a rickety staircase, pass throug half-rotted door. There are holes in the roof overhead an huge gaps on the floor where the boards have fallen throu They see Sam, his back to them, staring out a smashed win EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's scare the crap out of him... They begin to creep in, flanking the unsuspecting Sam. Bu as they get close, a SHAPE drops down behind them!
SHAPE

dialogues.speaker: ARRRGGGH
dialogues.text: Darren and Evra are the ones who jump. The shape is Debbi She almost falls over laughing. So does Sam. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see the look on your faces. But Evra and Darren are not laughing. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here? DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could ask you the same thing. We come here all the time. My grandfather used to work here. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've been a long time ago. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says now it's like one of those bombed out World War II cathedrals. Empty of what is used to be. An odd little moment till Sam breaks it. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we loved the show, man. It was off the hook. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (messing with him) Off the hook, huh? I'll tell all the freaks you said so. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys on your own? Just traveling. No parents or nothing? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No parents. He says it with a little twinge that Debbie picks up on. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No school either.
SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the luckiest guys on earth. Wanna switch places? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be different to be here. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different how? Evra steps into a slash of sunlight and his skin flashes life, the green of his scales catching the rays. Debbie's mouth drops. They couldn't see it in the dark last night. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has a place they belong. The Cirque du Freak is ours. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your skin is beautiful. That wins Evra over. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I touch it? Evra holds out his arm. Debbie traces a finger across it. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Has it always been this way? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a snake-boy. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't call him names because he looks different. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I am a snake boy. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say you're dermatologically challenged. They all LAUGH. Debbie considers Evra a beat, then Darren DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Darren? How are you different?
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get scared easy. Darren looks up toward the rafters. From where she droppe DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get up there anyhow? DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, how did a girl get up there? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spot where the roofing is gone, several long RAFTERS stretch out. Darren, Evra and Sam watch Debbie walk out o one. Like a balance beam. The factory floor 70 feet below EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, be careful. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. She's like a gymnast. Debbie moves slowly at first, her arms stretched out for balance. Then she does a hop, a skip. Darren and Evra gas She gets to the other side, turns and bows. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy! DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got nothing to prove. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it'd be easier for you than me. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that? DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because chickens have wings. She starts chicken CLUCKING. Mad, Darren steps onto a rafter, starts across. He stops in the middle, spins arou Aided immeasurably by his half-vampire skills.
Debbie is impressed. ANGLE OVERHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vertigo angle as Debbie walks back out on her rafter. Stops about 4-feet across from Darren. DARREN & DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren crosses his arms across his chest. No big deal. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's play mirrors. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do something and you have to copy me. Like this. Debbie crosses her arms the same way Darren has. He uncrosses them as he realizes. Debbie reaches down, touches her toes. Darren sighs, then does the same, gets a good look at the floor below. Debbie takes one foot off the rafter, takes hold of the t of it with one hand, raising the other arm out for balanc Looks like a ballerina. Evra doesn't like this daredevil stuff. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys... Darren hesitates. Not because he won't do it, but because maybe for the first time in his life, he's really fascina by a girl. Debbie misreads, starts CLUCKING again. Darren smiles, repeats her move effortlessly. Without warning, Debbie leaps the gap, lands on the rafte alongside Darren. As she struggles a bit for balance, Dar reaches out and steadies her. As they come face to face. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There definitely something different about you. I just can't figure it out. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Sam your boyfriend?
DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my cousin. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... A funny, awkward beat out on the rafter. Finally... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get off this. She nods, a bit smitten. Darren turns. As they start off. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chalk it up to lack of blood, but everything starts spinn DARREN'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area is like a big drain and he's whirling down it. RAFTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren legs go out and he falls off. As Debbie screams... Darren CATCHES HOLD of the rafter just as he drops past i DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Debbie grabs his arm. Evra starts out to help, but the rafter CREAKS OMINOUSLY. He stops. Sam states the obvious SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it'll hold you, dude. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the heads up... Bro. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes it off) It's okay. I'm okay. Darren swings up a leg, hooks it over the rafter. A beat he's back on top. Debbie relieved. Evra backs up the way came and in a few seconds they're all safely off the raft DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you hung on. I couldn't have. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have fallen in the first place... I just got dizzy.
DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you need to eat something. Darren looks at her. She has no idea. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the food's down on ground level. Let's get out of here. Sam and Debbie start off, Darren and Evra following. As S and Debbie start down a ladder, Darren hangs back a beat. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's kind'of cool, huh? I mean, for a girl. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like her. She asks a lot of questions though. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just curious. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as 'just' with a girl. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you such an expert? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My snake's a girl. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun peeps below the horizon. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren walks along, flashlight in hand. Going somewhere. suddenly stops, listens, not sure if he heard something. following FOOTSTEP? MOVE WITH Darren as he continues. As he passes through a doorway, he ducks around the corner. Waits a few beats. Then he leaps out to see who's following. No one's there. Shaking his head, he continues on. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren knocks on a door, waits a beat before it opens and Crepsley emerges from his sleeping place. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Darren. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's good about it? Crepsley looks him over, doesn't like what he sees. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling with activity. Nearly show time. Crepsley stands by an open tent flap watching Darren cross camp. Not well DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops as Sam and Debbie catch up with him. SAM DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Darren. Hi... Darren's happy to see them. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are coming to the show again tonight? DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Evra's doing his snake act tonight. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you came to see Evra. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you... Darren smiles shyly at that. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping for Amanda Bynes. Darren sees Crepsley watching him from the tent. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll catch up with you later. I got some stuff I gotta finish up.
They watch as Darren heads off. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna be gone in another day or two. Tonight's the last show. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. So? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So stop looking at him like you love him. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such an idiot, Sam. TENT OPENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren joins Crepsley, a little unsteady. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. You can barely stand. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to feed. You need blood.. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I won't let you hunt some poor person down for me. I -- Crepsley grabs hold of Darren, hauls him into... THE TENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, the inside walls richly embroidered. Medieval. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to hunt. There's someone here willing to save you. From the shadows: Madam Truska. Startlingly beautiful. Sh steps up. Eyes on Darren, she offers Crepsley her wrist. MADAM TRUSKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By my own free will, Darren Shan. As Crepsley's fingernail hovers, ready to open a vein. Darren shakes his head. 'No'.
CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink or you'll die. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't. I'm human. Crepsley releases Truska's arm. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not! And you'll be nothing! Darren stands there as noble and sad as a boy could be. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am human. In my heart I am. A great big TEAR rolls down Truska's cheek. That's the la thing Crepsley needed to see. He's defeated. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in their seats or taking them. Darren is back in h role as usher. He seats two people, wipes at the sweat beading on his forehead. He's getting sicker. He sees Debbie. She and Sam are already seated across the way. She smiles, waves. Darren forces a smile,, waves bac Looking for more patrons, Darren nearly walks into... A FIGURE. A hat pulled down obscures his face. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An usher in the house of usher. And I can't seem to find a seat. Darren frowns at the odd voice, but leads down the aisle. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. Darren brings him down to a handful of seats. The figure looks up from under the brim of his hat. It's Mr. Tiny.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Join me. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. As Darren moves to go, Mr. Tiny clamps a hand around his wrist. Like iron. He sits, pulling Darren down beside him

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: It's time we had a few moments. Folks involved in epic struggles should get to know each other. Darren doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Has Crepsley told you about me? Explained me? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you can't be explained. You need to be experienced.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: He gives me too much credit. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Darren. Darren looks up to see Debbie and Sam. Oh no... DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna sit on this side. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz we miss you so much. She digs Sam with her elbow. They sit just a row in front

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choosing sides can only lead to trouble. Never, ever choose sides unless it's your own. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've chosen the vampaneze. Mr. Tiny laughs, slaps his knee even.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Is that really what you think? A smart boy like you? And the lights drop. A trumpet blasts and all is silent.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAGE
dialogues.text: The little people wheel out a CAGE. There's a gurgled GRO The little people retreat. Several audience members lean then SCREAM as the wolfman CRASHES to the front of the ca
A white spot shines down on Mr. Tall.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen... DARREN & MR. TINY

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: .subjugators and saps...

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Cirque du Freak. We are an ancient circus... As Mr. Tall drones on...

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Oh, his speeches are impossible. Mr. Tiny opens his free hand. His pocket watch melts up i view from his palm. Time begins to speed up around them. Mr. Tall's voice speeds to a BUZZ as he 'keystone cops' o the stage and Rhamus 'keystones' on. The audience's small movements become rattles and shakes. Only Darren and Mr. Tiny are at normal speed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: I'm not so complicated, Darren. During war there are those who profit. A war between vampires and vampaneze would have terrible consequences. Therefore... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible profits.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Excellent. I am a profiteer. I exact fees and gains. I'm simple. On stage, Madam Truska exits and Evra 'keystones' through performance with his snake.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Did Crepsley tell you of the prophesy? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What prophesy?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: They say the final battle between vampires and vampaneze will be decided by a child. That's why the vampires won't blood children. To avoid the end of the world. As these words are pondered by Darren...

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: I think I underestimated you. I think you could be wonderful. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a creep. I think you suck.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Too bad. Mr. Tiny closes his hand around the watch. Time returns t normal. The applause for Evra slowing down to normal spee As he walks off the stage, Debbie looks back at Darren. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was great! As she looks back to the stage someone sits on Darren's o side. Collar pulled up, head wrapped in a scarf. Murlough MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low; re: Debbie) Is it Dar-wren's girlfriend? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about her -- Murlough takes hold of Darren's other wrist. Still low: MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has plenty of lovely blood inside. Inside, outside, hmmm? Darren struggles. Murlough pulls him close, HISSES in his ear, flashing those filthy teeth. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about humans. I don't care about you. But the vampire - Larten Crepsley - him I care about. (ALMOST SHY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough is a vampire killer.
On stage: the spotlight hits Crepsley. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are in trouble. There's more than one vampire now. Gavner Purl is here. Murlough reacts to the name. Does not like it. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Purl Gavner's face? Young Murlough sliced it for him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Darren, you're a liar. He's a thousand miles gone by now. And master Crepsley is right there. As he points at Crepsley... CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding Madam Octa's cage. Aware something's 'in the air' MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimmers, phases into flit mode. Disappears. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley! Look out! The audience LAUGHS. Like Darren's worried about Madam Oc Debbie looks back, knows something is wrong. Sees Mr. Tin hand around Darren's wrist. STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Murlough 'appears' alongside Crepsley. Madam Octa's cage drops to the stage as Murlough knocks Crepsley fifteen feet through the air. He lands flat on h back. The audience CHEER! Think it's part of the show. Murlough reaches into his jacket, produces a razor-sharp KNIFE in either hand. Crepsley pops to his feet. As his own single BLADE 'switches' to life in his hand... DARREN & MR. TINY As Darren struggles, Mr. Tiny switches his grip to the ba of the boy's neck. That holds him.
STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERS as Murlough charges forward, the long knives pinwheeling in his hands. His attack is brutal and blunt. Crepsley is driven back, parrying each thrust and attack it comes. Sparks fly as the blades connect. From out of nowhere, Crepsley adds a BACKHAND to the mix. catches Murlough hard across the chops. OFF STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tall and Evra watch. Not knowing what to do. STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough swings back wildly. Crepsley catches the blade i Murlough's left hand with the one in his right. Crepsley catches Murlough's left wrist, the second blade dangerously close to retracing the scar on Crepsley's fac Crepsley throws himself back, sending Murlough head over heels across the stage and SLAMMING into a concrete wall. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentrating. Trying to flit. STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough rolls to his feet, charges. It's brute force ver style. But as Crepsley moves to sidestep, Murlough's not brutish after all. He matches the move -- Buries one of his knives into Crepsley's stomach. Crepsle reacts, frozen in shock. DARREN & MR. TINY The audience around them unsure. Many shocked. It's part the show, right? Darren sees Murlough raise the other kni to finish Crepsley off. Darren trembling, phasing. And Mr. Tiny's holding nothing but air. Darren is gone.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN, (FLIT WORLD)
dialogues.text: Speeding down to the stage. The dagger descends in slo- motion, but it's only a centimeter or two from it's targe
STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren reappears, leaps onto Murlough's back, knocks him target. As Murlough staggers right, Crepsley staggers lef Murlough regroups, charges after him. Badly hurt, stumbli Crepsley falls off the edge of the stage. Disappears. ROARING, Murlough grabs Darren. They disappear as well.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TINY
dialogues.text: Sighs. This is not how it's supposed to go. Sam and Debbi leave their seats, head for the stage. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough with Darren in tow, looking high and low for Crepsley. Moving past the barely moving Mr. Tall and Evra

dialogues.speaker: CREPSLEY, (FLIT WORLD)
dialogues.text: His back to a wall. Trying to hold it together. Frozen PATRONS facing the exit beyond. As he'loses his flit powe the patrons suddenly resume real speed for the exits. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old power plant. Pipes and catwalks. Murlough and Darren here. A chain hangs from the ceiling. Murlough lif Darren, wraps it around his ankle. Hangs Darren upside do MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: CREPSLEY
dialogues.text: CUT TO: CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacting to Murlough's voice. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BOILER ROOM
dialogues.text: Murlough twists Darren's arm. Darren SCREAMS out in pain. CUT TO:
EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacting as Debbie and Sam arrive. They move toward it. CUT TO: CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening as the scream fades off. Clutching his stomach, Crepsley moves. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BOILER ROOM
dialogues.text: Murlough pulls Darren a little higher. They're face-to-fa though Darren is upsidedown. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley will come for his assistant. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't care about me. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough has an assistant, too. A smart one, smarter than you. As Murlough says this, Darren looks past as stepping up, grinning, is Murlough's assistant. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve? Steve! Steve holds up his hands so Darren can see the WHI SCAR on the tip of each finger. He gets closer. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tiny made my dream come true. Only better. I'm half vampaneze instead of a stupid half vampire. Mr. Tiny says I have a destiny. He says he's gonna make sure of it. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that who you talked to? Was that the internet guy? Mr. Tiny? STEVE (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty funny, huh? He introduced himself after you left town. (MORE)
STEVE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I think I've known him a long time in my head. In my bad, bad blood. Chilling. Maybe Steve is evil. He leans in even closer. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me back the dream you stole. Murlough motions Steve quiet, slaps a hand over Darren's mouth. Listens. Smiles. Whispers. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley comes. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley moving forward. Hurting. He slows, stops. As he looks back over his shoulder. Something's behind him. EVRA, DEBBIE & SAM Freeze as Crepsley looks back in the direction from which they follow. From their POV, Crepsley suddenly disappears SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go? They jump as Crepsley appears right in front of them. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evra... Get them out of here. EVRA BUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evra knows it's useless. As he nods, Crepsley turns and strides back toward where he had been. Sam and Debbie exchange a look. What the Hell? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys better go back. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren's my friend.
DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ours too. Sam's not so sure, but he nods in agreement. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren swings back and forth in long strokes like a pendu a rag stuffed in his mouth to silence him. DARREN'S POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping the room. Wait! It fixes on a doorway. There's Crepsley. Looking about, everywhere but at Darren. BOILER ROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley speaks to 'the room'. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can smell it. Why does it hide? (STEPPING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire is here. WHUMP! Murlough drops from above. Lands ten feet in front of Crepsley. As they begin to arc around each other. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampire will die. STEVE'S VOICE (FROM ABOVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get readyyyyy to rumble! Crepsley looks up, reacts. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the creatures of the night watch too much TV. Darren swings past through the middle of it all. Murlough charges. Crepsley sidesteps Darren, decides to take the fight high He leaps up, swings himself up onto one of the catwalks. Murlough follows. They use the room steel as monkey bars they climb, clash. Violent, quick attacks. Crepsley gaini a position, abandoning it as Murlough SLAMS in.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has lost sight of them, he can only hear the battle now. reacts as Evra, Debbie and Sam rush out. Evra takes hold, lifts, tries to lessen the load on the chain. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, unhook his legs. As Sam struggles, Debbie pulls the rag from Darren's mout DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys nuts? Get outta here! EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's against our code. Suddenly unhooked, Darren hits the ground. He looks up at Evra who grins down at him. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never leave a freak behind. CUT TO: CEILING SUPERSTRUCTURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the catwalks Murlough draws his knives. Crepsley jumps to the space he wants to defend, draws his own. Murlough counters. Two very serious predators'-at work. The animal kingdom at its killing best. A charge. Murlough a bull, Crepsley a matador. He redirec one of Murlough's arcing arms, smashing it against a meta housing. One of the vampaneze's knives clatters away. It's not graphic or bloody, but several times Crepsley's knife finds its way into Murlough's body. It enrages him, but Crepsley continues dealing out punishment. He's now like a brilliant counter-puncher, even as he inadvertently backs his way into a corner. But as quarters close in, Murlough's rage works to his advantage. He charges into Crepsley, his lowered shoulder sending Crepsley through the air and into... And through a BRICK WALL. Into the thin air outside! Stil raging, Murlough nearly falls through himself. Instead, h slips, drops about twenty feet down inside the building! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crepsley falls sixty feet, lands flat on his back, as bri and concrete rain on top of him... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Evra pulls Darren along. Debbie and Sam riding shotgun EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evra. I think I'm dying. He looks horrible. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's carry him if we have to. Evra and Sam support him on either side. They continue, start across part of a darkened backstage area. A dark rectangular shape looms ahead. We hear a GUTTURAL GROWL, sees eyes glow in the gloom. They freeze. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's the wolfman. He's in his cage. They move forward again, the cage becomes visible. But another SHAPE beside it. Steve. He sets his hand on the cage's heavy latch. He's going to open it. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No don't! STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooops... Steve lifts the latch. Even he doesn't expect the force t wolfman hits the door with. Whaanngg! It's out. Evra steps bravely forward. The wolfman sends him flying. Sam can't hold Darren up by himself. He doesn't even see Wolfman leap over. As Darren sinks to the floor... The wolfman tears into Sam...
DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacts in horror. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's more surprised than shocked. Until the wolfman looks his way. Then he heads for the hills, disappears into the dark. The wolfman turns back toward Debbie. She backs away, takes off up a rickety stairway. The wolf HOWLS, then follows. Darren's too weak to follow, near tears in frustration an regret. He watches after them, then he looks over at Sam. Sam who is dying. Just a few feet away. His eyes flicker Darren's. He tries to say something, but can't. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Sam. Oh no... Darren crawls over, takes Sam's bloody hand. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go save Debbie, Darren... Sam manages the smallest smile. As his eyes drift shut... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she loves you... From above, we hear Debbie SCREAM. Darren considers Sam's blood, knows what he has to do. Leave his humanity behind and cross the line. He needs to drink Sam's blood. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Sam, but I need strength. I need blood. As Darren extends his nails over Sam's wrist... DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to save her together. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie backing into a corner. The wolfman almost on her..

Murlough arrives! Pure animal action as he tears into wolfie, sends him retreating, licking his wounds into the darkness. Murlough heaves for breath, pretty beat up himself. And here comes Steve. Cautiously. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Crepsley dead? MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? Young Murlough lives, but he's hurt. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do? MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can Dar-wren's girlfriend do? We need to get the blood inside outside. Don't we? Then we hear it: a blood-curdling scream filters up. It's

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: He's drunk Sam's blood. He rises. His sickness wicking of him. Strength descending. Empowered. Furious. He screams again, the sound taking shape into words. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY STAGE SPACE
dialogues.text: The audience who haven't left react as the chilling sound reaches them.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE AREA
dialogues.text: Fully 1/2 vampire powered, he takes the stairs two at a t UPPER FLOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murlough, looming over Debbie, smiles as Darren arrives. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop being a big shot. This isn't like stopping some fight at school. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Steve.

Murlough's eyes go very, very dark. He attacks. Darren tries to meet the onslaught, but he's bowled over. Knocked in a heap. Debbie moves to go after Murlough from behind. She's goin to go down fighting as well. But Steve intercepts her. He pretty powerful himself. Murlough pulls Darren to his feet, stands him up. He swin his fist in a vicious arc. Darren just ducks it and Murlough's fist SMASHES right through the wall (an inside wall) alongside Darren's head Murlough's getting tired of Darren. MURLOUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to stand still so you can die. But as he attempts to pull his arm back through, he can't He frowns. Then his eyes widen in pain. Murlough jerks his arm back as hard as he can. The wall smashes open as Murlough brings his arm back through with Crepsley hanging onto the end of it. FACTORY SPACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience who remain chanting: "Refund! Refund!" They react as debris falls from above, smashes to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER FLOOR
dialogues.text: Crepsley brings up his knife. Murlough catches him by the wrist with one hand. With the other he grips Crepsley by the throat, SLAMS him hard into an I-beam pillar. Again.
