Then he squeezes. We can hear the cartilage crunching in Crepsley's throat. But Crepsley covers his own right hand with his left. He drives the knife blade INTO MURLOUGH'S HEART! Murlough looks down at the handle of the knife, then back Crepsley whose throat he still holds. Murlough gives him a lopsided grin and then pitches back, falling through one of the holes in the floor. Taking Crepsley with him.
FACTORY SPACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMS from the audience as Murlough descends. Somewhere mid-fall, Crepsley FLITS, disappears. When Murlough hits center of the stage, he hits it alone. Dead. As people start for the exits, we see Mr. Tiny'is among t UPPER FLOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as Darren stands, it's not over. Steve grabs Debbie, pushes her to the edge where the rafters are. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back! Or I'll throw her off! I mean it! It sounds like he does. Darren looks intently at Debbie. She looks back. Then, Darren makes CHICKEN CLUCK SOUNDS. Understanding, Debbie tears herself away. To the precipic But instead of falling, she continues out on a rafter. Steve slides out after her. But as he reaches for her, sh deftly skips across the rafters, jumps back to the floor. Before Steve can follow, Darren cuts him off. Below them: rows of jagged, rusty pipes. The remains of a pumping station. Shredded now, broken. Waiting to impale. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Steve. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? Steve lunges. They come together, trading shots, stumblin but still having to make the rafters. A missed footfall w be their last. They separate, try to gain position. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hear something funny? After your funeral, I went to see your parents. They continue circling. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they were fine. They acted like they barely remembered you. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren lunges, but Steve's ready. He CUFFS Darren in the head. Darren falls, ends up hanging. Steve looms, smiling STEVE (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your sister. She was moving into your room. They had a yard sale. I bought some of your stuff. Steve's foot on his hand. Darren about to die. Oddly: DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you steal money from my mom's purse? STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? Darren hanging there, dead grim. Steve's curious. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you ask? Is knowing that gonna help you rest in peace? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's just practically the last thing that ever happened between me and my dad was I was arguing with him. STEVE (FLIP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least you had a dad to argue with. A fury building in Darren. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was telling him he was wrong about you. That's the last time we had together. Fighting about you. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to tell ya. Your dad was right. How do you think we got the money for the dumb tickets? I took it. Just like I'm gonna take you. Steve jams his foot down into Darren's face, but Darren h on. In fact, with a superhuman surge, he hauls himself up no matter how many times Steve hits him.
WHAM! Darren lets Steve have it. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him so much. WHAM! Steve's arm pinwheel for balance. He's going over. But just as he pitches off the end rafter... Darren catches him by his belt. Nearly bent backward, he hangs back over the abyss. If Darren lets go, Steve will fall into the spikes below. Crespley steps up beside Debbie, knows what Darren should CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him, Darren. Do it now so you won't have to do it later. Darren looks at Steve. A moment they'll remember forever. DARREN (SOFTLY; SADLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He used to be my friend. Darren flings Steve back the other way. To safety. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start running. Don't ever stop. Steve hesitates. It wasn't supposed to be like this. Darr starts off the rafter toward him. One last look of hate. STEVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time... And he's gone. Disappearing into the dark. Darren joins Debbie. Nothing left to hide. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? Darren shakes his head. Sam didn't make it.
She understands. Darren looks at Crepsley. He's a mess. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna be okay? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to catch my breath. For a few days. Maybe a week. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I made a mistake, don't you? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think that you proved yourself human after all. Human. As Darren absorbs this kindness, smiles. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half human. What now? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a war on, isn't there? Crepsley shrugs. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This world is crossed by fences. You have to decide which side you stand on. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Black and white fences crossing very gray fields. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gray. I've met the bad guys. They need to be stopped. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure it's my fight. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said it. There's no in between. And the power of being alone is never going to be greater than the weakness. It's our fight. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As PATRONS try to get as far as they can as quick as they can. We see Steve duck out, blending in. Mr. Tiny's Lincoln Continental pulls up. As Steve gets in CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tall, Evra, Debbie, Darren and Crepsley. Crepsley set Sam's body down in the grass. It's covered with one of Ma Truska's tent silks. As Crepsley's eyes meet Darren's... DARREN (A WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a good kid. It's weird, but I remember things about him even though I wasn't there when they happened. Even though it's impossible. A moment as Crepsley nods sadly at this most singular boy CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blood is in you.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: I'll deal with the police when they come. What I'll say, I don't know. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what happened. Some crazy guy showed up. Sam was in the wrong place at the wrong time. They're all quiet a moment. EVRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was brave. DEBBIE (SADLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the only time in his life. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't die in vain. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Time to fly or flit or whatever you call it. The sun won't wait all night. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, that's exactly what it does. Mr. Tall manages a smile, considers the sky a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Time will tell what this night has brought us. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Keep my coffin ready, would you?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TALL
dialogues.text: Always. As they exchange farewells, Debbie turns to Darren. DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we'll meet again? DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know. As she hugs him tight, she whispers in his ear: DEBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so... DARREN (WHISPERS BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope is a good word. I hope so, too. And so goodbye. Darren and Crepsley start down the road. DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To meet the Vampire Generals. War clouds are forming. A storm is coming. And I have a feeling you're needed much more than I am.
DARREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we waiting for? Let's go. Crepsley offers his hand. CREPSLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my arm. Darren shakes his head, doesn't need it. He shimmers, flits into the night. Crepsley laughs to himself. As he follows... FADE TO BLACK.
